Some of it was pretty good (the abstract paintings, for example), but a lot of his work consisted of poorly drawn coyotes. I'm not trying to be a jerk, and it's possible that the true meaning of his work just flew right over my head, but that was my interpretation of what I saw :) So many pictures of coyotes!

The remaining part of the museum contained a lot of artifacts and objects created by different Native American tribes. That part was pretty interesting as well, although I tend to prefer paintings over artifacts/objects, so I wasn't super captivated. After finishing up with the actual exhibits, we checked out the gift shop, and while we didn't buy anything, it had a pretty good selection of stuff to purchase.

Overall, I can't imagine I'd ever come back here. I am interested in Native American and old Western culture, but only as much as I'm interested in most other things, and there are lots of other museums to check out in the world. That being said, if you're particularly fascinated by the themes explored by the work in this museum, then I definitely recommend you go, as there's a good amount of content and some of it is pretty cool!

I freaking love Sauce on the Side. Best calzones ever. I always order the "Meat me in St. Louie." It's full of different types of meat, garlic oil, and provel cheese and served with a side of meaty marinara sauce. The crust of the calzone is soft but not super doughy and rubbed down in butter/garlic. Mmmmm

I've had bites of other calzones that friends have order...you can't go wrong with anything you choose from the menu. It's all delicious. 

Sauce on the side also delivers! How amazing is that?! AND they are open til 2am!

They also have dessert calzones. Last weekend we ordered the Banana Nutella one and it was mouthwatering. We split it among 4 girls, which was perfect.

I highly recommend Sauce on the Side if you're craving pizza, but want something new and interesting! It's great!

I love my morning coffee.  Someone must have told all of the servers at Honey's Sit-N-Eat, because three different servers asked us four separate times if we wanted a refill.  The space is small and drafty, but cute.  It reminds me of the Pacific Northwest, and I get all misty-eyed.  I digress... back to the food.  I got eggs with nova lox mixed in, with grits and sausage.  Bonus for the sausage having a sweet flavor to it.  I prefer nova to stand alone, and not be mixed in with the eggs, oh well.  The only thing "southern" about this place is the grits, and not really.  Honey's grits are thick, whereas I've always eaten smooth and creamy 'southern' grits.

Absolutely love this venue. I was here last night to see Bonobo/Jungle and being the geriatric that I am.. definitely took the whole.. show starts at 8 thing as.. Oh the show must actually start at 8. FAIL. HOWEVER, everything was A-OK when I realized the venue is attached to a pretty cool bar that you can access easily. TIP- you can drink at this bar and save yourself $2 on a beer... plus they serve craft beers on tap. When I was there they had the 312 IPA, A bock from chattanooga (Amazing), Red Hare, and a couple of black abbeys. 2 craft beers was $10. 2 domestic tall boys are $9. Heads up-- Happy Hour is until 7pm on weekdays and they had awesome specials that include 2 for 1 drafts. Outside seating is great-- a bunch of picnic tables. Plus/downside is outside is smoking. WHICH means inside is no smoking- which I cannot believe. It was so nice coming back from a concert and not having knocked off a couple years from my life + not having my amazingly beautiful hair reek for the next week. 

Venue is a pretty large warehouse. Great acoustics. The cleanest bathroom I have EVER seen at a club/music venue. AND there was no line. Seriously. 

Loves it! Now I just need to get a kimono, cropped top, high waisted shorts and body glitter so I can fit in.
Great quaint place. Service was good food was really good, sat outside, brought my dog, they were even attentive to her.  I would love to go back and try more items on the menu.

Famished all day, I was on a mission to find a new place to eat, but something fairly close to home. I felt adventurous, but NOT that adventurous to go too far.

After living in the Tower Grove area for nearly 2 years, I finally decided to give Black Thorn a shot. All I've heard were good things minus the long wait people usually endure when coming here.

Jason and I got here around 7:30. To our surprise there was not a line nor was it insanely busy like we had anticipated. Another thing we had not anticipated was the set up of the place.

You have to place your order at the bar, get your own drinks from the bar, and pay all before you receive your pizza if you aren't going to keep an open tab. It basically has the same concept as a Bread Co. or Qdoba. Once you order, they'll bring you your pizza out.

We ordered a 12 inch Chicago style sausage and pepperoni pizza and a bowl of caesar salad to hold us over until the pizza came out. Little did we know that we were going to wait 30 minutes to receive the salad, then an additional 30 minutes after that for our pizza. As mentioned before, it was not busy. It had a few patrons, but not enough to cause the wait like we had to.

8:30pm. Pizza is out. We're ready and holy hot damn, am I excited! The pizza lived up to the hype I had hoped for. The time spent waiting was well worth every bite I ate. I think the only downside is the wait time. I don't know how long it takes to cook the pizzas. I'd assume awhile considering how thick the crusts are, but still, could they not have told us?

As far as the attitude of the bartender, I have to agree with Aimee K. The girl looked like she had a blank stare on her face, and she didn't seem too pleasant to talk to. I asked her when our salad was going to come out, and her reply was, "when we get to it." I went back to my seat and continued to wait without questioning. I didn't want anything to happen to our beloved deep dish pizza!

Anyway, aside from that, I like Black Thorn. The rustic looking 1980s dive bar setting who outlived its hay day truly adds character to this place. It has darts, hurling, and a juke box. You can't go wrong, especially in this hipster neighborhood.

Come check it out and you'll see what I mean.

I love this place.  The Mountain roll and the Jazmine roll are my favorites.    The servers are very nice and quick to get your order.  Of all the sushi places I've been this is my favorite.  If you go during the week for lunch and want to sit at the sushi bar get there early as it fills up fast with IGT right across the street.

Our family is from San Diego and so of course we love Mexican food. We search for Carne Asada and it led us here. 

They have Carne Asada Fries?! Yes they do! They also have Carne Asada Nachos! 

Yummy! My fried were a little soggy but next time I'll ask for my fries to be well done. The wait wasn't too long at the drive thru (about 10 mins) 

We'll be back!

I think I was too harsh on City Fitness. I have a one month pass I got in the mail to try it out, and it's growing on me. the biggest downside to me is that it doesn't have the equipment I've come to know and love at the Penn Pottruck gym. if you're really into crossfit style workouts, this isn't really the place for you (unless you join Thrive and work out in their area which looks to have amazing equipment!). there are no bumper plates, and i really wish they would leave an extra barbell permanently in the area next to the leg press machine for deadlifting (there is a trap bar.. but meh). it's a small space, so they can only fit so much in. there's only one set of 12.5 lb dumbbells downstairs for example- which is a popular size with women, so if other women are lifting i usually have to wait. i also noticed today when i was leaving spin class that they do group personal training downstairs in the astroturf area and take it over which is a bit of a bummer because i love using that equipment (trx ropes/kettlebells). i'm not sure how often that happens though.

on the plus side, it's open almost all the time (5 am to 1 am) - this is HUGE for me. i am a mom and being open that early means i can work out and get home in time to have breakfast with my kiddo before work. same goes for being able to book a spot in a class online ahead of time. it's incredibly convenient. the amount of classes offered is also excellent and i like that there are classes offered on the weekends. i've only gone to spinning so far but every time the instructors have been great. the location is fantastic too if you live or work in G-Ho.

Lordy, lordy. This place is amazing.

They've got your classic flavors plus some unusual ones that you won't see anywhere else. Like Magnolia flower, Lavender, lemongrass, etc. I had the petit four flavor ... Yummy. I personally love ice cream with mixins like cookies and cake, and Creole Creamery's are great. They also have seasonal flavors that they rotate.

Stop reading. Go eat their ice cream.
This shop is lovely!! They strive to keep local/handmade items in their store. It's a great place to go if you need a unique gift for someone. The owners are super nice!

I have many memories of Plaza Bowl from my childhood - birthdays, school trips. I think my mom was even in a league there for a while. I've always thought of it fondly but hadn't been back in many, many years. The one time I did attempt to go recently, they were closed! I went for dinner nearby last night and actually parked right outside. After our meal, hoping there weren't leagues in there, we decided to head down and see if we could knock some pins over. 

I felt like I stepped through a time machine and came out in 1993. Absolutely nothing has changed and I love it. There are 12 lanes, but they're not all in a row like other bowling alleys. There are six on each side of the room. The wooden benches remind me of old church pews. The bowling alley is in a basement, yet there are curtains all along the walls. I swear the lady working at the front is the same one from way back when, too. 

The price for a game is cheaper than other alleys - $4.50/game. Shoe rentals are $2.00. You can get a few snacks - chips and beer. The lady told me they usually close between 9:30-10pm.

There are leagues every night except Thursday night. We went on Wednesday shortly before 7pm and the teams started playing right around 7pm, although they were only using six of the lanes. Call ahead if you want to be sure. 

They don't make 'em like this anymore.

Yes, it's expensive.
No, you can;t do your "regular" shopping here but it is terrific for taking kids.

We came for the "No Kid Hungry" cupcake event (for $3 kids could decorate a chocolate or vanilla cupcake) and the kids (both age 9) loved it.

My daughter loves to shop the bulk candy department and there are some unique holiday gift ideas here also.  Look into their cosmetics (Pacifica for CHEAP!) and chocolate bar sections.

No, it's not cheap - but there are some unique items here that I can't get at Whole Foods (aka Whole Paycheck) nor Trader Joe's.

I love coming to this place for lunch. I'd come for dinner but they don't have my favorite menu item at night. It's the gigantic shrimp burrito. It's so huge. I shouldn't eat the whole thing but it's so hard not to eat it all. When we come, we usually get chips and salsa. Their salsa is very delicious. Also a pitcher of sangria. It is pricey. It it's great. It's very refreshing for a mid day pick up. I would love to try other items on the menu but I can't seem to stray away from the burrito. It's that good. Def try this place out for lunch. I don't think you can go wrong.

I LOVE this pizza! Seriously don't understand the low reviews! 

Slices are huge and packed full of flavor.  The base is thin and crispy, perfect ratio of sauce to cheese to topping, lots of variety, cheap, cheerful and the staff were friendly too.  

I also need to mention that the mix in their pop-dispenser was excellent.  Really tasty coke zero (this is important!!) 

What I gave an extra star to (and would have given it 10 more) is their limoncello cake - sweet baby Jesus it's one of the nicest cakes I've ever tried in my life (and I'm a fussy home-baker!) so much so that I went back two days in a row, for cake, for pizza and for a cheap feed on the way back to my hotel from the Children's hospital!

I will start this review by saying, bless the hands that makes their food. Li'l Dizzy's is soo dang good. 
It is a family establishment which is so nice. You really feel the warmth of the establishment. Also, Dizzy is named after the owner's, Wayne Baquet, grandchild. 

The first thing I ate was the grilled biscuit. That biscuit was fantastic, I didn't think it could get any better. But guess what?! It did. I ordered the grits, eggs, and catfish with a side order of the fried chicken. THAT FRIED CHICKEN WAS SO DARN GOOD! It literally was the best fried chicken I've had. The skin was just the right amount of crispy and the seasoning was amazing. I love thick grits and Li'l Dizzy's grits was the perfect amount of thickness. 

The owner, Wayne Baquet was very personable and kind.  Also, another staff person came to check in on us. I did not eat the buffet, but they do offer a buffet for $17.99. I didn't get it because I planned to eat later. The the buffet included gumbo, fried chicken. The sweet tea was the perfect level of sweet.

I wasn't a fan of the catfish. It tasted like the river to me and my sister. However, we are city gals, so that review with a grain of salt.

I will definitely be coming back and next time I will try the buffet!!

On the boarder is one of my favorite Mexican food chains. I consistently have good service and have never tried anything I didn't like. 

I had the one of the burrito bowls with portobello mushrooms and it was really good. I think my favorite thing to eat here is the chips and salsa. I love their salsa it's got enough spice to add good flavor but it isn't too hot. Chips are served warm as well. 

I sat in the bar and had great service. My water was never empty and they made a great Caronarita

Stopped in here with my husband on Harry Potter night. Atmosphere was really open and friendly plus they had drawings of literary characters on the wall. The bartenders were so friendly and we really enjoyed chatting with them as well as getting drink recommendations. Even if you're not a beer person, they still help you find something you'll enjoy. (And you can ask for a sample before you commit to a glass.) 

I love that they have such a large amount of events to get the community involved. BBQ nights, movie showings, and even trivia of popular television shows. 

Loved the staff, loved the building, loved the beer. Can't wait to frequent this place more often.
Love, love, love the coffee here! It is impossibly smooth. The soy lattes are always perfectly made with the right amount of creamy foam. Adieu, Starbucks.

I love Honey's. Honey's [greater than] Sabrina's. No garnish taking over your plate. An extensive menu at all times of the day. No turning the wait for a table into a cute little activity with stale hot chocolate, just heat lamps outside the door when it's cold. The service is fast and on point. The wait can be a little long, but it will take you even longer to get back in the car and drive to the downgrade of your choice (Oregon Diner, IHOP, Sabrina's, etc.). 

Most importantly, the food is great. Good vegetarian options. The vegetarian Frito chili pie appetizer takes me back to high school football games and my carefree meat-eating days. The latkes are crispy and delicious. My favorites are the breakfast quesadillas and the enfrijoladas. Usually, if huevos rancheros are on the menu, I will order them. But it's nice to have a few similar, but different options here.

I love Honey's. Dig it.

Not attempting to be dramatic here, but The Wine Loft is one of those places where I am seriously stuck between 3 or 4 stars....
3.5 would be my true rating.

I sometimes lean towards 3 because of the overpriced eats such as the Trio Of Spreads ($12) appetizer that I ordered tonight. Sure the fig olivade, 
baba ganoush and hummus with pita bread were tasty but I don't think the price matched the plate? I also awkwardly waited for a table at the host counter for 5 minutes without any staff member addressing me during that time.

-BUT THEN-

A scrumptious glass of well-edited wine makes it sway to the table while a melodic live acoustic performance serenades the room makes me steer 4. Our waiter was efficient and professional as well.

I dig the space and the flow of the room with little nooks and various types of seating. You can meet here for meetings, events, and or a low-key evening out due to the cast of mood lighting which literally feels like it swallows you. I dig it. I still have yet to check out the upstairs area but loved the spiral staircase that led up to it. 

I will try this place out again so hopefully I can finally make a "big girl" decision about this debate. I am sure that we are all holding our breaths...

TIP: Wednesday night is "La Femme Night". 
Signature Cocktails and Martinis for only $5 for all the ladies. Sometimes it pays to be a dame!

I have a serious weakness for Culvers crinkle cut fries.  Pretty sure it's because they are fried with the rest of the offerings.  In any case, I love me a small order of fries with a vanilla custard concrete mixer.

One complaint about this location...they always have about five to six people working the counter and one or two people splitting time at drive thru and the labor intensive concrete/shakes.  And no one ever seems to help out even with no one else in line.  Other than that, the store is well maintained for a fast food operation and the kiddos and I enjoy coming here for the aforementioned treats.

I really loved this place. The bartender was awesome. The prices are higher than I would normally pay buy the French 76 be reach was so refreshing and delicious that 2 will give u the perfect buzz. 

We had great service, great atmosphere and will be coming back.

I rarely post on haute darlings of the moment, or even long-standing stalwarts. I take exception here as I feel as if someone just gifted me with my NYC/Soho Pegu Club twin and saved me a roundtrip ticket and the horror of JFK/LGA. some striking similarities btwn the two that pleases me greatly.

We went as a couple around 8.30pm on a Wednesday. Had no problems getting in and finding a table, there were also plenty of open seats at the bar. 

Location: down the street from Fogo & Mortons, around the corner from the crazy Dunkin Donuts on Penn, i.e. located just off a corner block-- so it's easy to stumble out and get a cab; or, park in the convenient public garage across the street.

Ambiance: It is not 'lounge-ish', but relaxed & enjoyable nonetheless. It is a longish room, high loft ceilings, modern clean lines, grays and whites, soft lighting. Not too dark where you can't read the menu, not too bright where the mood is shattered. not too big not too small, trendy but not too cheesy I'm-trying-to-impress-you, not too loud that you can't hold a conversation without losing your voice, not too hushed that you feel awkward laughing outloud, high end but not pretentious. Bartenders in uniforms of vests and newsboy caps. Great place to come on your own, with a small group of friends, or on a date.  NOT a place to come to get rowdy.  

Service: The host greeted us with a welcoming smile, bartenders were all smiles and seemed to love what they were doing.  Waiter was extremely attentive, competent, and well-informed on all menu items.  No condescending or impatient attitudes anywhere.

Price: As mentioned by others, slightly higher prices but at this joint you know you are getting quality. And it caters to that clientele that can appreciate that distinction. I feel the price is right.

Drinks: The drink menu is a work of art. This is not your average bar-- this is not even your average artisanal bar. This place serves up another realm in a glass. Excellent handcrafted concoctions. The menu is categorized by the main spirit-- i.e., gin, whiskey, rum, tequila, vodka, and yes, absinthe. You will find your classics as well as some more intriguing choices. The drinks are made of the finest ingredients, and each drink is precisely as you have wished it when placing your order.  Their signature, the Seelbach, was a successful delicious start.  Every drink thereafter was also divine. You can tell they really put time & effort in making their cocktails.  All are beautiful and there's an elegance to them.  Many come with very nice in-house steeped fruits & syrups. They do offer a fine wine and beer list but I could have cared less.  You want beer, go to Twenty-tap or Tomlinson. You want wine, go to Corner Wine Bar... or find your Opus at Kahns across the way.

Food: Delicious small plates. Again, obvious invested thought, quality, and careful preparation here. I recommend getting food if you sit at a table. We had duck meatballs w gnocchi in a wonderful jus/sauce, 3-bacon flight w/ condiment sides of aioli/beets/horseradish-ketchup, lamb rilette w shallots/mustard/ super thin crostini, and the perfectly grilled one-eyed jack with fig jam & roasted garlic. the bacon (from Smoking Goose) was my favorite. Everything was delicate yet hearty, if that makes any sense. Next time I'm going for the apple salad, mushroom salad, beef tataki, and either the pate or one of the sandwiches.  We saw others getting the oysters. 

Little Touches: white cloth napkins. fresh herb garnishes. check out the quirky personalized coasters. the postcard that comes with your bill. the pretty orange peel zest. 

Synopsis: 5 stars. I loved everything about this place. Yes, more than both Ball & Biscuit and Black Market.  Easily.  If you enjoy quality cocktails in a mature, urbane setting, this will quickly become a new favorite... I know I'll be a regular at The Libertine.

Alberto's was my go to place when I was still in school because it opens until midnight and it's cheap! Plus they have a 10% discount with a student ID and it still is one of my top choices for when I crave Mexican food! Horchata is always a must for me as theirs is not too sweet or taste like it's made from powder. I typically get the vegetarian burrito but this time I got the torta and loved it. Instead of the beans, because they are cooked in lard, they let me add whatever I wanted, so I did the rice and tomatoes. The bread is my favorite part- soft and aromatic. My boyfriend got the California burrito which is different than what the options most of the other Mexican restaurants offer: it comes with fries inside the burrito which sounds weird but is actually really good. The burrito is already salty but they add salt so depending on your preference, you may want to ask them to leave the added salt out.

Came here for a Mets/Phillies game (Mets won, FYI).

Our seats were pretty good, a couple of rows from the front in left field. They were pretty cheap too, and then we understood why - the place was mostly empty (for a Friday game!). We basically could've sat anywhere.

Anyway, in terms of the "newer" generation of baseball stadiums, Citizens Bank Park is pretty good. Reminded me a lot of my beloved Citi Field, with more walkways and public seating in the upper areas.

The whole place is really tiny - you could walk the entire thing in 20 minutes if you really wanted to.

Beer prices are what you'd expect at a game, but decent selection.

Food selection was fine. The Chickie and Pete's crabfries line was ridiculous. There's also a Tony Luke's. I went with Campos since the line was the shortest and I wanted to try their chicken cheesesteak (meh).

Only thing that I can ding them on is how far out of the way it is. It's right by Lincoln Field and the Wells Fargo Center, so I guess great for tailgating. But a pretty far Uber ride from downtown.

I agree with my real-life friend pre-Yelp and pre-FB about this place. And I just looked over the other reviews. There is ABSOLUTELY something rotten in the state of Denmark here. The slew of 1 star reviews are by people who have from 1 to 3 reviews total. One was a flat out fake and one by a Montecito resident I personally know who is quite possibly mentally ill/delusional.Sadly, he got 25 notes on this review as he's a writer and funny. 

I forgot about it for awhile, living on the border of Montecito and SB and staying mostly on Coast Village Road. 

I had a great brunch here last year, trying the butternut squash pizza with the crinkly sage (flash fried I think), goat cheese, mushrooms and truffle oil . Sublime! 

The new bartender , Hannah, is terrific and knows her wines. She told me the Riesling was too sweet for her and that if I liked less sweet Riesling, I'd not be happy. I tried a Sauvignon when I picked up my to go pizza and liked it so much I ended up staying for another. 

About 2 years ago, when Piatti closed, my boyfriend and I had a wonderful dinner and I remember the succotash side fondly along with a soup and appetizer but don't remember what it was specially, but definitely one of us had fish. 

Piatti was, well, Piatti. The best thing about it was the decor and the 7/glass Piatti cab, along with that bread basket with the chili /balsamic dipping sauce. A good budget meal with the 7/glass wine and a soup or appetizer. 

But Piatti was underwhelming and probably lasted as long as it did for sentimental reasons. 

The Wine Bistro is far superior both in terms of food and overall experience. We love that side room with the little fire but the  main room is nice as well. 

The clientele is pretty much the same, lots of Montecito locals and longtime residents. 

I will come back soon, at least for a drink and appetizer. The sides are terrific and if you want to keep the bill down, wine by the glass and a couple sides is the way to go.

Love love love this place even i am not a vegetarian!! My favorite dishes are tofu wrap with special spice and chicken sandwich!! They also have awesome smoothies which will bright your day!! I love green smoothie the most. This has already become my regularly visit lunch place if I go out with my coworkers!!

Came here for lunch with a few of my friends and was pleasantly surprised by how great the food was and the size of the portions. I order the spicy beef pho while my friend ordered a curry dish that I didn't know Vietnamese even had and a Bahn Mi. My soup was very good but the curry dish was outstanding, definitely something I would love to have for myself next time I go. The vietnamese poboy bread was perfect. All in all this was a wonderful dining experience at a good value. I will be back. PS the mango smoothie with the tapioca balls is great.

Loved this place! Perfect for the pup to mingle and get out energy. My pup loved the little dog area although not as cool as the big dog spot! The park is very pretty and great for an afternoon. People pick up after their dogs and there are benches. Great park check it out!

They may run out of food, get there early.  I was disappointed that I couldn't get brisket because I saw that it was sold out.  We wanted to get wings and brisket platters, but we needed to replace brisket. The guy in front of us told us to get the nachos, so we agreed on it.  Then came the great news, we were told we can still get brisket shreds on the nachos, so we did that.  The wings we got we got half super hot and half white bbq.  They don't sell alcohol at the counter so they told us to go to the bar.  We ordered the Bloody Mary.  Upon ordering, we noticed you can order food at the bar too, so you don't have to wait in that long line at the counter. 
The nachos were the best nachos I've ever had.  The chips are made in house and topped with cheese, sour cream, green onions, tomatoes, BBQ sauce and the brisket.  Definitely get this with any order.  Next was the wings, I loved the super hot, white BBQ was ok.  The chicken itself was cooked perfectly.  The Bloody Mary was also one of the better bloody Mary's I've had, give that a try as well.

Decor-small with less than 8 tables.  

Service-friendly.

If you want your food quicker-check out the menu by the cashier and order right away.

I like their self serve pastry area that has plates for those that are dining in or bags for those who are getting it to go.

I got the guava danish-the dough was light, fluffy, and the guava jelly was good.  It wasn't too sweet, but a bit thick for my taste.

Blueberry scone-delish!  Especially with honey :D

Pomegranate raspberry green tea-perfect pairing for my fruity pastries.

My other friends ordered:

chocolate croissant-really rich.  if you are a chocolate lover this is the pastry for you.

banana nut bread-didn't try it, but my friend said it was good.

the cubana-open faced cuban topped with a tomatilla sauce.  It was yummy, but took a while to get.

I've said it before and ill say it again, I don't like going out for Mexican food!! 
Everytime my husband suggest a Mexican restaurant I try really hard to steer him away from mexican. 
Sadly, this time I gave in and we ended up at La Parilla Suiza. We walked in and the hostess took us to our table, our waiter came and brought us salsa and chips and took our drink orders. The salsa was really good.
I ordered a combo of tacos de alambre and chilaquiles and my husband ordered the enchiladas. Im sorry to say that those tacos were the worst I have ever tasted. They consisted of beef meat with sauteed onions,tomatoes and chile. The meat was very tough and dry, as if it had been previously made and left there. Now for the chilaquiles, it was tortillas chips in bland tomato sauce. I don't know if restaurants are aware that they are supposed to be spicy, I mean common, its in the name "CHILAquiles". If your not going to make them spicy, then atleast add some flavor to the tomato sauce. I had to add some of the salsa to make them taste better. My husband thought the enchiladas were ok but nothing to come back for.
I have to say that the service was good, but I do not LOVE the food here so I doubt we will be coming back.
Once again, another mexican restaurant I don't love.

I literally lived across the street from this place and didn't try it out until right before I moved out of STL! 

I really enjoyed the Block! From my experience the items that are a little cheaper tend to be much tastier! I went with a big group after my graduation and the people in my party who ordered the specials and the bigger plates/entrees seemed not to be satisfied with their meal (i.e., someone ordered the steak and didn't love it, someone else ordered the fish special and was not thrilled)... but everyone who ordered the sandwiches/burgers really seemed to love it. All the drinks and cocktails were delicious. 

Items I really love: the bacon jam, and the brussels sprout! Also the burger and pulled pork sandwiches are delicious here! 

I was a little nervous because I had a large group and they dont take reservations! But I just called in ahead of time to check and they said they would work it out. I appreciated how accommodating they were! Everyone who works here is so friendly and helpful. My only complaint is that the service is EXTREMELY slow and the wait staff seems super disorganized. For instance, one time I went there there were 3 different waiters who tried to serve us (even after we explained someone else was already helping us). 

It is a good thing I didn't try this place out until I was about to move out of STL because it is a little pricey. Overall, I'd recommend it to others!

I have been coming to Hellas my entire life! They have some of the most authentic Greek food around, not to mention an amazing bakery!! I came here with my family recently and had a great time. We shared a Greek salad, my absolute favorite appetizer - Saganaki, and for my main course my boyfriend and I shared a sampler platter. He loved the gyro meat and pita. My favorite here is always the dolmades, they put a lemon sauce on them that is delicious! 

If you are in the sponge rocks area be sure to stop in Hellas! When you are finished you can head next door for the freshest baklava!

If you haven't heard, the Tuesday Blue Plate Special is now Tacos and it is a sure fire way to get a good Mex-Fix. 
You'll have three tacos; a chorizo, a carnitas, and a mixed-vegetable, along with rice and beans. As usual you'll get the flavorful house salad and a glass of iced tea. ( I love their salad dressing, wish it was available bottled.)
Now let's talk about the new blue plate itself. I'd be hard pressed to select which taco I thought was best, each was in a class of it's own.  I was surprised that I actually liked the vegetable taco. The broccoli had a crisp snap and the red pepper and onion added extra flavor.
The beans were just okay, need something to give it  a bang. Ask for their hot sauce, add it to the rice and you've got a great side to your tacos. 
This place is still the best value for lunch.

Finally made it here!  Super friendly staff. I went for a late dinner with a friend.  We waited in line to order our meal. The person in front of us was having trouble deciding what to get and the cashier took her time to give the guy recommendations. We ordered a large salad strawberry salad and duke calzone to share.  I love that they brought out the salad already plated before the calzone.  I don't usually expect that at a place where you order at the counter.  The salad was pretty good.  Maybe a little too much dressing but I love that they aren't stingy on the nuts and cheese.  The duke calzone was very good and flavorful.  We didn't even need the sauce for dipping.  They also brought an extra plate without me asking (I hate when food comes out and you have to ask for a plate and wait there with the food sitting in front of you).  They are also really good about clearing away the used dishes on our table so they don't stack up. The wait for food was pretty quick and we paid a total of $22 before tip for a yummy dinner.  When we left I think every staff member that was in the dining room said goodbye with a genuine smile on their face.

There are so many mixed reviews for Casselli's that I was really hesitant to try it.  I have been to so many lackluster "authentic" italian restaurants in the area that I was getting frustrated.  When I walked in, I was greeted by the most friendly hostess that took us to our table. We started off with the salad and the soup.  The salad dressing was really good. 

I was having a hard time ordering because there were so many good entrees to choose from. I ordered the Bruschetta Tilapia because I love bruschetta. Every bite was phenomenal.  
When I went the restaurant was temporary BYOB, but I would call ahead to confirm this because they are trying to get their liquor license back.  Also, it is Cash Only.
I can't wait to come back!

I have no idea why this place doesn't have better reviews. I loved it! The price was super affordable and it's in a great location. I got a full king studio suite and was upgraded for free to a room with a balcony during check in. My room had an awesome view of everything on Ben Franklin parkway. The hotel staff was very friendly and professional. I forgot to bring toothpaste so they had someone bring some up to my room for me. Room service did a great job every morning and even replaced the shampoo conditioner bottles for me even though I did not finish the previous bottles.

There are two restaurants downstairs that are open late. Con Murphy's and asia on the parkway. I tried both of them during my stay and thoroughly enjoyed each one. Don't forget to use your room card because hotel guests get a discount. 

The location was perfect for me to get around everywhere. Just a block away from suburban station and there are many bus stops around the area. Two taxi lines always available around the corner. It's right next to restaurant row so you have a huge variety of places to eat within walking distance. The museums are also right up the street. 

The room itself was quite impressive. I had a full kitchen with stove, microwave, refrigerator, dish washer, keurig coffee maker.. Couldn't have asked for more. There was also a full walk in closet with hangers. Sleeping area had a VERY comfortable king sized bed, small dining table, office desk and tv. 

I will definitely be staying here again during my next trip to Philly!

Love Texas Roadhouse!!!!  But lets be honest this Texan loves anything with the word Texas in the title!  When we are in the mood for steak and don't want to drive far this is our favorite choice in Avon!  Wish they had lunch hours during the week.  

Steaks are aways cooked exactly how we order them and the bread and honey butter are awesome!

I've going to "Dr. Bob" for years now.  I love coming to him.  Helen, his front office person, is so sweet, and almost always gets me in for a same day visit when I'm hurting and simply can't wait.  He always shows me stretches to do when my neck and back are hurting from cycling.  I love that he bikes and runs and can relate to my problems.  I usually get a short deep massage, my neck cracked, and a little shiatsu. I'm so relaxed when I leave that I just go home and fall asleep.  He always fixes me right up at a great price and takes my insurance.  My friend was able to avoid back surgery by coming to him.  Everyone in his office is so friendly and personable.  I recommend him to everyone I know, and he gives discounts when you refer!

This store is so cute! I love all of the art, local goodies, and cute vintage clothes. Prices are reasonable and the owner is so nice! She offered us complimentary chocolate chip cookies while we paid. The store is kind of hard to find if you don't know where it's located because it's tucked back behind a wallpaper store. But once you find it, it is worth a stop!

For those who haven't been to Wayne, it's adorable. Home to the original Anthropologie, Wayne has a central downtown area full of cute, probably overpriced shops, a lovely privately owned moviehouse, and the Gryphon Cafe, a coffee shop of the sort that this original Midwesterner misses. 

Very pretty decor with very strong coffee, a great list of teas, and excellent sandwich and soup options. Served on beautiful Polish blue floral china and mismatched mugs, the coffee was a great pick-me-up. The 1/2 soup- 1/2 sandwich combination is a perfect amount of food, served with housemade chips. I had the hummus sandwich, which is hummus that is decidedly housemade, and thus of the less garlicky, slightly runnier sort, but really good. Accompanied by cucumber, tomatoes, and arugula, it's a great sandwich on the whole grain bread. The soup I chose was the tomato-carrot, and it was fabulous. 

The atmosphere is fun and easy-going, and the staff is extremely pleasant. It's also nice to be in a coffee shop with that much space and that little rush to move on.

This location is located next to the Michaels and Golfsmith Golf/Tennis store in Des Peres.  Chick-Fil-A is just about the same at any location but this particular store always provides service with a smile.  The store is clean and service is very prompt.  
This location does have a play area for kids which is nice, as well as a drive through.

This particular evening we were attending a "spirit night" for my kids elementary school.  Its nice to see that they support local schools as well.  
Each time we have eaten here the food has been great.  My kids love the chicken nuggets which is made with real white meat.  I tend towards the spicy chicken sandwich.

I love Roast, it's my place to escape during a crazy day at the office. Yes, it's quite hipster but I still love it. The brick walls, the pressed tin ceiling, the local artwork and the reclaimed wood tables -- and of course the coffee. I was disappointed when they took their maple bacon latte off the menu, I think that drew in a lot of people here. But they said it cost too much to keep on the menu, unfortunately.

I still enjoy the chocolate cherry latte, it's not as sweet as it sounds. The pumpkin pie latte is also good, and I hear the chai hot chocolate is a treat too. The toasted marshmallow latte is quite sweet though, just to warn you. For a cold option, I like the coconut frap .. it's nice and light, not too sweet. You can switch between cold and hot for most of these options though.

I've always found their pastries to be delicious and never stale, unlike other coffee houses. The lemon swirl is to die for, if you like a strong lemon taste -- lots of flavour in every bite, with chunks of chewy lemon. Yum! The cinnamon swirl and chocolate croissants are also tasty. I was sad when they discontinued their key lime cookie, those were delicious! Unfortunately it wasn't popular enough so they took that off the menu too.

Go earlier in the day if you want to score a pastry with your coffee, otherwise it's usually just sandwiches left by the afternoon and I'm not so sure about those if they've been left out since morning.

From my first visit to the last Milktooth has that somethin' somethin' that keeps me coming back for more. I think it's the sexy sorghum glazed bacon, yes, most definitely the bacon and probably the Sweet Tea Fried Chicken and the Dutch Baby Cornmeal Pancake but most definitely the bacon. 

Here's the nitty-gritty:

Space/Ambiance - Open, inviting, and captivating. From the coffee bar to the open concept kitchen "to the windows to the walls" there is something magically creative happening here and it's exciting just to sit back and watch. 

Drinks - A wide and vast assortment ranging from artfully presented espresso drinks and pour overs, to cocktails, beer, and wine. I might be so bold to say their latte is one of the best I have had in a long time. The presentation and the addition of Traders Point Creamery milk adds a special local touch. The bottomless house brewed coffee on the other hand was a bit strong for my liking, but wasn't undrinkable, just a bit too rich for me. I have not yet had the pleasure to enjoy one of their cocktails. I do have my eye on the White Bloody Mary. Next time! 

Food - I have tried the Sweet Tea Fried Chicken, Belgian Waffle, Dutch Baby Pancake (sweet variation), Uova AL Forno w/grilled Merguez Sausage, Sorghum Glazed Bacon, and the Chocolate Shortbread. The Sweet Tea Fried Chicken is a great dish and is consistently delicious. The gravy and chicken pair so well together like a perfect harmony. If you order the Uova Al Forno add the Sausage. It definitely adds to the dish bringing in great flavors. I really enjoyed the Dutch Baby Pancake & Belgian Waffle but felt the portion size was small without the addition of a accompaniment from the adjacent menu. This can be good or bad depending on how you look at it. Good if you want to pair a few dishes together but bad if your on a budget.

My Experience - Most recently I decided to share Milktooth with family which included my dad who is the pickiest eater on earth. He simply refuses to eat anything green and sneers at ingredients like pickled avocado and clementine confit. Knowing full well "modifications are politely declined" I was a little uneasy and had my fingers crossed that he too would have a pleasant experience. To my amazement the man who hates most food groups loved his Belgian Waffle! Hallelujah there is hope!

Special Notes - I like that you can enjoy a coffee and/or pastry while waiting for your table. It's also nice to be able to get these freshly made items to-go if your short on time. 

PS: Just writing a review about Milktooth is making me hungry to go back. Word on the street is the Cinnamon Sugar Potato Doughnuts are mind blowing!
love the sides and poppyseed chicken.  keep this place secret and to yourself, like Nashville.. it's a hidden gem.

I won tickets through Yelp for a chance to see A Midsummer Night's Dream and I had a great time! Now not having seen a Shakespeare play in quite awhile, I was slightly lost with some of the dialog in the first act but the second act was much better. I loved how the set changes were fast and flowed very easily given that the stage is on the smaller side. The costumes and the sets were simple but gave enough for you to imagine as you watched. 

Since I had won the tickets, I called and picked my date and seating over the phone and the process was super easy. We picked up our tickets at will call and when we got seated, I noticed that there didn't seem to be a bad seat in the house. The lobby, theater and even the bathrooms were beautiful! I loved all the details from the walls to the ceiling and I'm sure when I go back, I'll see some things I missed. It's an absolutely gorgeous place. 

I found it very interesting that you could have a  drink as you watched. There were two bars both with drinks and coffee. We grabbed a few drinks for the second half and that was nice to be able to enjoy then while you watched instead of having to drink them during the intermission. I can definitely see myself going back.

Once upon a time, I worked in Hazelwood. Angelo's Chicago Taste was minutes away from my job, so naturally, I found myself there for lunch quite often. 

The place serves a wide variety of items, ranging from tacos to burgers, and even baklava. 

But I came here for one thing, and one thing only: a Chicago dog! Okay, two things: a chicago dog and a gyro. But who's counting? 

The Chicago dog was prepared pretty authentically, as far as I could tell. The red hot chicago dog was served on a poppyseed bun and had all of the traditional toppings, even the neon green pickle relish. Yum. I loved it. 

The gyro was tasty, but not my favorite. The meat was pretty dry, not juicy and flavorful like I was hoping it would be. 

Prices were cheap and service was friendly. I wouldn't drive all the way out to Hazelwood to come back, but if I was in the area, I'd probably stop by.

I'm a fan!  We bought the living social from a few weeks back ($15 for $30 to spend) and tonight we finally cashed it in.  We decided pretty last minuted to go out to dinner and called them a little after 7pm (on a Friday!).  They sounded crazy busy on the phone but said we could come at 8:30.  We showed up a few minutes before and the place was pretty full (and they were setting up for a large group which took up 3-4 tables).  We had to wait about 15min for some tables to clear out and we ended up at the sushi bar.  

The menu is pretty huge and they have sushi and non sushi options (bi bim bap,udon, terriyaki etc).  We went for sushi so that's what we spent the most time pondering.  The place was super busy and it took them a little bit to take our order, but one of the sushi makers was super on top of things and had someone come over as soon as he noticed we were no longer absorbed in the menu choices.  We started with the veggie tempura which was well done and the dipping sauce was really tasty (more like a broth than a sauce).  There was carrot, sweet potato, asparagus, onion, broccoli, and cucumber.  Yum!  

For the sushi we got: Raw Viking Roll, The Stallion Roll, Sweet Potato Tempura Roll (I loveee sweet potatoes), and a normal yellowtail roll.  I have to say they were all well done.  I hadn't had torched sushi before so the Stallion was my first time, I was a little wary since I generally prefer raw fish to cooked fish but it was soooo good!  

So after this great experience, we decided to keep it going and ordered the tempura vanilla ice cream.  It was HUGE.  At $8 I was a little wary of ordering it since I figured it would be small, but goodness did they give us a ton.  It was gorgeously presented with fresh cut strawberries, and giant mounds of both tempura ice cream and whipped cream.  I can't believe we finished it, but I'll admit that we did.  I wish we had taken pictures of everything, but we both left our phones behind so that we wouldn't get distracted (ok really I just forgot my damn phone!).  

After all of this the bill was only $60 ($55 pre tax).  After the living social was applied it was only $30, yayyyyyy.  Had it been a little less busy it would have been perfect.  We found out at the end that they were down a server for the evening which had a lot to do with the chaotic nature of the place that night.  

We don't live far from Makiman and will DEFINITELY be back when we're craving another night of sushi (or maybe for lunch if we want some bi bim bap!).

The Love has been on my list since I first heard about it (before it was even built!) and I finally had the opportunity to go with some out of town friends. They were late so the hostess refrained from seating just me which is fair but then the third was stuck parking and then they were nice enough to seat the rest of us to get started (we were running late for a show). The decor was also super cute!

Service was lovely, the waitress was just attentive enough but not hovering and she was very conscious of our time crunch! Which wasn't even her fault so I really appreciated that! 

Now on to the food:
Fried chicken: well seasoned but a bit dry, bud & marilyns may have the win on this dish.

French Fries: Thicker cut and seasoned very nicely, we enjoyed them!

Steak with tomato salad: the steak was super yummy, seasoned but not overwhelming. The tomato salad was eh, a bit bland and the tomatoes weren't tasty enough to carry themselves.

Overall I wasn't disappointed but I wasn't in love (sorry, had to). For the price I just was left underwhelmed.

Love this place! Discovered it last year during "Hot August Nights," and made it a point to eat there twice this year.

I have yet to find a disappointing item on the menu. From their Chingalingas appetizer to the tacos, all great. Here's where it might get a little weird, though: if you are a fan of calamari, I cannot recommend the calamari steak enough. It is amazing, so tender and lightly breaded, with an incredible lemon sauce. This struck me as being completely off-the-wall for a Mexican restaurant, but I'm glad I tried it. I have to have it every single time.

The joint itself is pretty unassuming, just a basic restaurant with the obligatory laminate tables and neon bar lights. The food is what sets it apart, for sure.

Solid brunch place in Tucson. 

Let me preface this review by disclosing that my usual stomping grounds are Los Angeles and Scottsdale, the brunch capitals of the West.  And call me, #basic but I love brunch more than most things.  My friends and I came here because Prep and Pastry was way too crowded (1 hr wait, no thank you!) and Ghini's had none.  The interior is cute and French-themed with painted trellises, stained glass art, and artfully placed wine bottles, which would please any Francophile.

I ordered the carafe of Bloody Mary, which I really enjoyed!  We got it Nola style so it was spicy, and the alcohol content was on point.  For my entree I got the spinach, ham and swiss crepe.  Not mind blowing but definitely not bad. I had some of my friend's croque madame. also not bad.  The stand out of this meal was definitely the bloody mary.

They were more than happy to accommodate for all the outside requests we had.  One of my friends is notoriously picky and always customizes her order.  the servers at Ghini's took it in stride.

The best part of this cafe is that you can split the check really really easily!  I wish the brunch spots in LA would adopt this policy.  Added on a whole star for the ease of this payment scheme.  You just go to the front, tell the cashier what you ordered and you pay for it. 

There is also a bakery appended to the other side of the cafe.  They sell macarons, cookies, huge pull apart cinnamon rolls, and tarts.  The cookie I got was ok.

South Grand needed a pizza place in the middle of it all, since nearly every other type of dining destination existed. (Sure, you can order Elicia's, Imo's, CWP's, etc....but a legit dine-in pizza spot failed to exist. PIZZA BY THE SLICE IS HERE!)

A few days ago, my lovely fiance opted to grab a slice to go. He noticed that they only did NY-style by-the-slice, but he was really craving STL-style (since he's new to the area and had JUST tried it for the first time the prior weekend). Apparently, National was pretty dead, so he figured he'd go ahead and ask if they could do a STL-style slice. They said, "sure, why not?" and told him to come back in about fifteen. He wandered around Grand for a minute and came back, only to be surprised with a full-on medium pizza! I got to try it for dinner (since his lunch provided leftovers), and it was great! It's not the best STL-style pizza, but it's awesome that they were so nice and flexible and I'm sure they'll get into their groove in due time. (It lacked a certain seasoning that I've gotten used to with CWP's...but I can't put my finger on it. It was still GREAT, it just wasn't the best!)

Today, I worked all morning and took a long bike ride afterward. I didn't want anything heavy and I was craving salad. Apparently, not one freakin' cafe or eatery on South Grand does a Greek salad, and I was craving one something fierce. I didn't have the car and I wasn't about to get back on the bike, so I figured I'd mosey over to National and see what they had to offer in place of my OH-SO-DESIRED Greek salad. They have three salads available, one being a "house," one a "caesar," and one a chicken breast thing of sorts. As I am a vegetarian, the last salad was out. Caesar didn't appeal to me, so I opted for a House salad (the small is $3.95 and the large is $5.95 + tax). I didn't know which dressing I wanted between two of them, so they were gracious enough to just give me one of each. I also don't eat pepperoni, nor do I particularly care for cherry tomatoes, so they happily left both items off the salad. What I got wound up being just mixed greens, grated provel cheese, croutons, and dressing...but it was actually a REALLY good salad. (I took it home and tossed it together in my own big bowl.) The ingredients are fresh (and the cheese is AMAZING). I wouldn't hesitate to get this salad sometime in the future.

Also, they have this spinach-stuffed deep-dish pizza that looks out of control. I think I must return and try it out...when I'm feeling a little less healthy!

I can't believe I haven't written a review of R's since I have breakfast here several times. 

So here goes: first of all we both love this place, especially the outdoor dining (always breakfast). Secondly, the staff is super friendly and truly seems to care about the customer. Third - the food! Even though it is a somewhat limited menu, everything is excellent and usually more than I can eat. Finally, it is priced right!

Rembrandt's is our go to breakfast spot when we have out of town company because we believe they exhibit everything we like about the Treasure Valley.

I love this place! I finally got to go here while the night was young. I was able to pay attention to my surroundings since I hadn't been drinking before I got there. I sampled some of the delicious food, the Cuban sandwich and the amazing duck fat fried potatoes with Parmesan cheese sprinkled on top. The dipping mayo based condiment on the side was integral to these amazing potatoes, as we're the banana peppers on the Cuban. Both great. My drinks of knob creek and water were $7 which isn't to bad, and they were nice and strong. The bathrooms were amazingly clean. Had a great experience!

I love the feel of the restaurant and the view of beautiful City Park.  This is a great place for a romantic meal and get the old New Orleans feel.  The lamb is excellent but a little small... which gives you more room for some wine, right?  We had a weird king cake dessert which I immediately regretted.

I'm so glad this is a restaurant space again. Pre-K I went to Christian's often and it was nice to back inside this churchy location.  

The food was wonderful. I started with a lovely mixed green salad with a pungent & delicious blue cheese. And then had the stuffed baked shrimp withe hominy cakes. Seriously tasty. My dining companion had a very lemony/anchovy-y caesar salad (and I mean that in a good way) and then stuffed salmon with gnocchi and asparagus. Since I sampled her food too, I thought the gnocchi were a bit heavy, but still delicious.  Then for dessert? AMAZING dark chocolate creme brulee. Seriously y'all, I love fancy chocolate pudding and this was the fanciest (and tastiest).

Only off note was that our server was struggling. The restaurant was busy because of superbowl weekend, but we never did get to hear the specials and had to ask for more bread.  Not that big of a deal really, especially when you view it in light of AMAZING dark chocolate creme brulee.

Although I went to Tulane for undergrad, I strangely never had the opportunity to go to this establishment until recently. I'm so glad I finally made it in! I went with my boyfriend, who studied abroad in Paris for a year and a half and is very familiar with a Parisian style patisserie. He was so excited that something of the sort could be found in NOLA. 

Upon entering, we were treated to a tempting display counter filled with a variety of different French pastries. After browsing the extensive selection we decided on the Opera cake, a chocolate croissant and a ham and cheese croissant. 

My boyfriend couldn't get over how comprable everything was to a Patisserie that could be found in Paris. The Opera cake and croissants were as good if not better than what could be found in the best of pastry shops in France. 

The chocolate croissant was decadent, filled with delicious dark chocolate and the texture of the croissant was flaky and crispy. A perfectly made pastry.

The ham and cheese croissant was filled with delicious ham and gruyere cheese. Fantastic. 

And the opera cake? Don't get me started on the opera cake. It had layer upon layer of sweet and delicious fillings and cake. The bf swears that Maple Street Patisserie's version is better than anything that could be found in Paris. 

All in all, Maple Street Patisserie is a fantastic option for any pastry lover. I can't wait to return and try all of the other promising options!

Honestly....I don't see how its any better than a Wendy's burger. HOWEVER, the fries alone get all three stars. I love fresh cut fries and you can order them extra crispy and they will fry them twice to make sure you have a heart attack. You would think the cajun seasoning would be a big win for me, but I like them with just the sea salt they use. Sometimes simple is better.

I can definitely see why fellow Yelper Elise T. would go or not go to Paddy Whacks based on the position of the sun in the sky. 

I love that it's spacious, and that there are actually 2 separate bars. The bartenders were very friendly and fun. We happened to stop in right at the end of the "Running of the Micks" so the crowd here was quite diverse. I love watching hipsters, toolbags, and 4:00pm trainwrecks awkwardly interact. 

This place has huge potential to turn into a hair gel and steroid-fueled fist pumping extravaganza at night. But to relax with cheap beer and watch the game, it would absolutely be a fun time.

I am ecstatic that Duchess opened Provisions. I seriously don't think there is a happier person in all of YEG. I adore Duchess with my whole heart, and I will extend the same love for it's sister Provisions. So much amazing stuff here: macaroon kits, cook books, jams and jellys, different types of flours, what more could you possible ask for? There is everything you need to make tasty french treats all in one store. Plus if you are hungry you can go next door to pick up some goodies! 

Not only will you be able to tackle any baking endeavour after visiting this store, many of the items would make lovely gifts. Everything on this store feels like it is on display, the packaging is perfect and it makes you feel like all warm and fuzzy inside. 

I just want to wander and get lost in this store. Look at every cook book and day dream about all the tasty french pastries I could whip up.

Stopping by in on a Saturday is a dangerous move for a dog lover!  I had to pick up more dog food for my pup and it seems every Saturday there is a dog rescue adoption.  Today there were more dogs available for adoption than usual.  There were so many cute little puppies and even a three legged dog that stole part of my heart!

I really like the PetPerks discount, it's nice to save some cash on pet supplies.  They have a pretty good selection of dog food, toys and grooming supplies.

One of my favorite places to shop!!!!

When one walks around Home Depots garden center one can become depressed. Their plants are just so sad. There's no love, only a giant corporate box store and their giant corporate farms located who knows where. The quality at GoB is sooooo much better than most garden centers I've been in. The plants are well taken care of and you can tell just by looking at them. The plants are shipped across the country, they don't arrive dried and shriveled up. I find plants that have gone through this end up being dried and shriveled up, or over watered. They usually die within a month. Now to be fair I'm a terrible gardener, I have no green thumb to speak of. But the hostas and caladiums we bought from GoB this past spring are still trying to sprout and it's December! I certainly know I forgot to water them quite frequently during the blistering summer, but they never died! That's what I mean by quality. We bought the plants when they were tenderly taken care of at the store, so when they came home with us they already had a good chance of survival.This past summer I was impressed with their home gardening options, including veggies, lettuces, strawberries and other plants that you can start growing in your own backyard. They also had a bunch of really cool herbs that you can't find at the grocery store. 

We recently came back to GoB to get our first Christmas tree. They are grown right here in Tennessee, ethically. Plus a portion of the profits goes to the TN Environmental Council. Take that home depot. PLUS their trees all get names! We bought Tom a stout five foot little Frasier Fir for only $35 and let me tell you, he smells absolutely wonderful!

Gardens of Babylon is a very special place in Nashville and I highly recommend visiting them!

I wish there was a half star option, so I could say 4.5, but since there's not I'll give it the benefit of the doubt. 

I really liked this place! I will say as a disclaimer that I didn't eat here, but I did drink, dance, and see a show. 

My friends and I came last weekend to see the Disney After Dark burlesque show, and all of us loved it. We laughed our asses off. Don't get me wrong, there were sexy moments too. And live singing, which I definitely wasn't expecting! The show featured characters like Beast, Ursula, and Maleficent. Maleficent and Ursula, both drag performers, were absolutely fantastic. I really liked the balance of men, women, and drag that were all here. Way to be inclusive, 708!

We also had drinks. Two (of the four) of us were a little bummed because we wanted to try a cocktail called the Cruella de Ville, but they were out of one of the ingredients. It was a definite bummer but, stuff happens. Our "cocktail kitten" (I believe her name was Serenity?) was super sweet and apologetic about it. Instead I had a Lost Boy and a Tarzan, both were well poured and good, though I preferred the Lost Boy. I loved that the servers were dressed in burlesque style outfits as well- the one dressed like Alice is stunning. Our server was super cool about taking the Yelp discount, and was just overall really attentive and nice. 

After the show, we grabbed a few drinks at the bar. The bartender was super nice and attentive. The cocktail kittens were friendly and energetic and danced and talked with us, which I appreciated because all four of us were women. I was happy to see that they weren't just focusing on the men (which I've seen at other bars). I took a selfie with one of them, and she let us know if we checked in on Facebook we'd get a free shot. Which, who says no to a free shot?

We wandered outside to drink, and it was just a really great night. I'm not from the area, and have never been on that block in STL before. Everyone was really friendly and chill, the weather was warm. There was just a nice (and safe) vibe all around. 

I will definitely be back. Hopefully, to try the food next time as well. Thanks for a great night, Seven Zero Eight!

They always serve with a smile and even on the busiest day and time, I am served quickly. They know their busy time and make sure to have extra servers. Quick, clean, and always delicious! 

The outdoor seating area does have some shade and I have eaten there. I love that they allow you to fill your water bottles if you bring them.

Audubon cottages are lovely. Smack dab in the quarter with a swimming pool, private courtyards, butler service and fantastic showers in old New Orleans architecture. Extremely close to quality restaurants. I'll update with additional details but want to thank the ladies - shout out to Courtnie for handling so many random requests and questions.

Monday has 1/2 price mules--which are awesome. Love the old-fashioned cup; makes me feel like Paul Revere himself coulda made them. 

Black bean burger is damn good and the pretzel bread, unmatched, friends. 
They also have a ton of games in the side room, which is cool. Outdoor seating. Friendly bar staff and clientele. Where everyone knows your name. Especially if you live in the hood.

After reading the reviews on here, I expected to be blown away by my meal, but to be honest, my omelet was kind of blah -- it was too big and overcooked (also, note to restaurants everywhere: an omelet is NOT eggs with a bunch of stuff scrambled in -- that's a scramble).  My friend ordered the special, salmon eggs benedict, which were pretty weird -- the salmon was cooked and chopped instead of the usual smoked, and instead of english muffins, everything was served atop a huge pile of potatoes.

We did both love the latkes, and for that I'll bump it up a half star.  But overall I prefer more quality and less quantity in my brunch.

I now understand the accolades for this place. So often when I come across a place like this, with such great reviews I find the staff to be a little disconnected with their customer. They seem to be flying high from knowing they are "good". But, today at Milktooth, not only was it a culinary journey but also it was warm, welcoming and I felt like I had come home. The place was bustling no doubt, but they aren't pretentious in any way. A friend and I met here for lunch today and we were welcomed at the door by a genuinely friendly hostess. There was a bit of a wait so we grabbed a menu. Whoa, OK I am a foodie and will try almost anything. I know many of the culinary terms, etc, but this menu is dizzying. So many unique preparations and melding of flavors it was hard to know what to order.  It wasn't  long before we were seated at the "bar" top which we were fine with. From here we could see all the action in the open kitchen. 
I ordered the cvemellia - which was a coffee drink with apple, matcha, pistachio and steamed milk. My first sip was this velvety, smooth, warm, creamy most heavenly fusion of flavor of wonderfulness!!! (Make sure you check out my photo of this drink). As I'm sitting there enjoying my drink a staff member walked up to me and asked me if I liked my drink. He told me it was the first day for this drink on the menu and he was the person who created it. I love it when I get to see the passion behind the artwork. 
My friend and I ordered the sorghum glazed bacon to share and it was gooey, sweet, and perfectly cooked!!
I ordered the grilled Welsh rarebit Dutch baby and my friend the cranberry walnut grilled cheese and we shared. Both of these dishes were journeys in culinary delight. Very different flavors and combinations, but everything was delicious. 
This is not a place you go if you are looking for your average every day lunch fare. You go here if you want to take your taste buds on a journey!!! And go here you must!!

What's not to love here?! Corks has more flights than any other small tasting room I've had the chance to frequent, so there really is something for everyone. I love that they offer both local and international wine options, as well as beers from SoCal hotspots and breweries in other states. I most recently got to try a bunch of Boulder beers here - it's so interesting to see what other areas have to offer!

They've also gone a step further than other spots in the "Funk Zone" and teamed up with local bakeries and restaurants to offer food flights that compliment their wine and beer offerings. I love that small business teamwork, guys! And it says a lot that they put in the extra effort to expand their clientele and bring a new dynamic to their tasting room. Keep up those delicious burgers and cupcakes!

Last but not least, I have to gush about the staff and the overall ambiance that they've helped create in this cozy little spot. They really make you feel like you're right at home by remembering regulars and talking to you about more than just wine and beer. I'll obviously be back as often as I can :)

Friendly staff - yeah! Love the busy yellow and blue design in the room - very cheery.  

Helpful, as most rooms face in, meaning there is not a lot of natural light that gets into the rooms.

Stratus is the 10th floor roof bar/dance club, and Friday (and probably Saturday), they get pretty popular.  On the 8th floor, I could sense rather than hear, the background music, but it was a nice background noise, not offensive at all.

Comfortable lobby, fantastic location around the corner from the Liberty Bell and good food and coffee and in a safe location (important to note in a city like Phili).

My fave place to stay in Phili.

The store was great - they had some nice dresses out front that made me make my way inside. 

I loved the jewelry and the accessories. They have some lovely pieces and I fell in love with this puzzle necklace! (I love puzzles!) The store is quaint and has a funky vibe. Wish I could have found more of these while walking around. 

The prices are fair and the merchandise is cute! Really liked it!

I had to post an updated review because our second visit to Pizza Fusion was really lovely.  We were attending an event at Tampa Theatre and this was a great spot to grab some dinner.  This time around we started with the Stuffed Mushrooms and the Dip Trio as we were there during their awesome happy hour specials!  The stuffed mushrooms were fabulous, each topped with a perfect dollop of goat cheese.  The Dip Trio included artichoke dip, olive tapenade and marinara sauce.  All three were good but I really really loved the olive dip.  I went with the BBQ Chicken pizza.  I had looked at some of the pics here on Yelp and this pizza looked a lot like one I used to love at Pizzaria Uno - specifically one where there is no tomato sauce but a healthy smear of BBQ sauce.  This one was everything I was hoping for and delicious!  The hubby went with the Big Kahuna - a pizza with bacon, pineapple and red onions.  The balance of flavors was nice and the pineapple was super fresh.  Great dinner and one that will bump Pizza Fusion a little higher on our regular rotation list.  I am excited to see how the coming changes to the ownership model and menu will play out with this location breaking away from the Pizza Fusion franchise.  See you all soon!

Having just moved to Edmonton, I am constantly looking for places to put on my top ten list. I have to say North 53 is on it. 

The decor and atmosphere are conducive to everything from a relaxing night with a friend to a date. Heck I'd even bring my parents here to showcase some fine Edmonton eats. 

If you start off with a cocktail you're on the right path.  As a fan of Old Fashions, I cannot recommend the Smoke and Oak enough. In addition to being an absolutely superb drink, it comes with actual smoke (no spoilers, but it's really worth it). Second to that I really have to recommend the Sazerac. It's the perfect balance of your traditional Old Fashioned with a zip.

My recommendation would be to share plates between people. The mushrooms and popcorn chicken are amazing. 

If you're not looking for a large meal to share between two people, just a main for yourself, I strongly recommend the double cut flank steak.  

Whatever you chose, you really can't go wrong. The staff are fantastic, the food is delicious and it's a great place to spend a lovely evening.

Love this cute dessert bar!! I'm new to the area and picked this for a client meeting. I love the assortment of treats and found it hard to pick just one. I had the banana cream pie in a glass and it was the perfect size, wonderful taste and left me feeling satisfied not full. We shared a pot of mint green tea  as well. The staff is great and I'm looking forward to visiting again. Oh and they are dog friendly too, with menu options for your furry friend. Sit outside and enjoy the people watching.
Love this store, they have a very friendly staff and always willing to help you out! They don't hound you like any other places. They pretty much have our dog items in stock! Love going here!

My friends had to come looking for me in this store because I was stuck in the whiskey section marveling over their selection. I didn't even make it past to the other parts of the store! 

They had an EXTENSIVE selection of brown spirits. Being a whiskey drinker I was in heaven. Staff are super knowledgeable and helpful. Would have loved to have spent more time exploring but my bank account is probably grateful I didn't. 

As it was, I purchased a bottle of Chicken Cock and a bottle of Willetts and I was a happy woman.

I used to love Fresco and ordered there all the time when I worked down the street.  Well I moved around and kinda forgot about it but now that I am back in their delivery area I recently started ordering again and it's delicious!  So far we have just stuck with delivery and have never had a problem.  Our go-to is the Totally Topped pizza without green peppers.  Always arrives fresh and gooey with a nice chewy crust, similar to Magpies.  They have a large variety of salads and those are always very fresh and they have a good chunky bleu cheese too.  Wings are oven baked and while we prefer fried we still have to order some when we call.  Overall we really enjoy Fresco and hope they keep up the good work!

Awesome place!  We went for dinner and ordered the Prix Fixe menu.  The Fois gras was to die for and the mushroom soup amuse-bouche was A+.  I had the Lobster en croute, charcuterie and dessert trio.  

The service was impeccable.  Atmosphere, modern and romantic.  We loved Cafe Ponte.  I plan on going for lunch very soon also as I hear it is just as baller but at lunch prices.

Thanks Cafe Ponte!
Fast and delicious. Sonoran Hotdogs are great, tacos are great, now with a big screen TV for sports games. Love It, BK Rules!

Plenty of parking outside. 
Located on a visible corner. 
Store is beautifully decorated. Adorable vintage decor and souvenirs in their gift shop are one of a kind. 
The service is great. They quickly do their best to sit you down. 
Their food is sooooo delicious! I love their French toast with hash browns and eggs 
I definitely recommend this location to anyone. It's by far my favorite breakfast place. 
Food is delicious and affordable 
The staff is extremely helpful
It's clean

Came here with a friend of mine to try out cake for her wedding and we were absolutely blown away! The samples we tried were so tasty, we wished we could've had an entire cake of everything: chocolate, vanilla, almond. Next, the frostings. The almond was so tasty and we both loved the hint of glitter in it, wonderful. Though we liked that was the best, it was a pretty hard choice between that and the chocolate. If you ever need to order a cake for an event, definitely come here. They are very kind and extremely helpful!

Thank you NHA for bringing Roxie Bagels into our life!  Roxie Bagels, daughter of NJ mobster Tony Bagels, is one tough cat!  She has a clubbed foot, I'm guessing it stems from an altercation back up north.

No but really, my boyfriend brought me to the NHA to cheer me up.  The NHA was clean, friendly, and had a pet for everyone.  I especially like that it is a no-kill shelter.  So I made it out of the cat room, it was tough, I wanted to adopt like 4 of the cats.  Then I headed over to the dog room and they had puppies!!!  Awww.....on my way out of the dog room I found my boyfriend upfront in the first room when you walk in.  Inside was Roxie, cat of the week.  She was up on his lap and rubbing her head into his arm.  She was adorable.  We left that Saturday and I could not stop thinking about her.  So cute!!  The next day I submitted an application.  She had been in the shelter for months and I knew we were the right home for her.  I was able to pick her up the following weekend, thankfully no one adopted her that week.  They gave me all of her paperwork in a nice neat packet with some really informative reading material.  It took a few days for her to acclimate but now she's part of the family.  She plays hard and we love that!!  She naps on her window seat and even sleeps with us most nights.  What I love even more is that the NHA called a week later to follow up.  They have a great rapport with their customers and I would absolutely adopt from them again.

Came here for a friend's bachelorette party and had a great time. I had the brisket enchiladas which came out cold but were quickly replaced with a brand new dish. We loved the customizable guac option, especially since we all have very different preferences. My favorite was the crab guac with double garlic. It was delicious but definitely on the smaller side, even to share. We also had to order chips and salsa, they did not come with our meals. The drinks were unique and delicious, and the service and atmosphere was nice.

I confess, I am a Sephora and Ulta shopper - I price compare on ebay, also and it pains mne to pay retail after spending YEARS in the spa industry.  Meanwhile, I stock up on Tweezerman, NARS, Lorac, MUFE (Makeup Forever) and other staples at this Center City location.

The ever-changing line up of staff (usually young overly-made up MUAs) is friendly and usually pretty knowledgable about makeup.  Skin care?  Not as much.

Meanwhile, I love Sephora - and have since its creation.
It continues to evolve.

There was so many items I'd been looking forward to trying: Mussels, Beet Salad, Cauliflower, Trout however none of these items were available during my dining experience today. Although I was a little disappointed I cannot deny the fact that Reed's left a delicious taste in my mouth. 

Starting with the ahhhhhmazing Mushroom Toast. Just the right amount of bread not to overwhelm or soak up the flavors. There was an assortment of delicious mushrooms: shitaki, crimini, oyster cooked down (almost stew-like) mixed with fresh tomatoes and goat cheese topped with delicate frisée to form the perfect "appetite curver". Don't Google "appetite curver" I totally made that up just as I typed this review. 

I was going to leave well enough alone as none of the dessert options really raised an eyebrow for me. That was until I had a brief but in-depth conversation with my convincing server Tasha.
