The preserve is part of the Great Florida Birding Trail and one can see numerous species as they migrate. nest, etc.
I enjoyed the birds of prey aviary which had hawks, owls, a turkey vulture and a five year-old bald eagle. They have all sustained injuries which will not allow them to be set free. I forget how huge and powerful these creatures are.
There's a gator tour, wildflower tours, night tours and the education center is a blast with numerous exhibits of the local flora/fauna.
There's overnight camping and picnic tables as well.
For $3 one can get their money's worth/ There's also a volunteer program where one can help out a few hours a month and get in FREE!
A must see for nature lovers!
Boyd Hill is closed Mondays as well as Thanksgiving, Christmas and New Years.

I am giving this place three stars because I think I did it wrong. I'm the kind of person who doesn't feel full when I get a cold meal, and that's exactly what I did.

Chipotle style line up, but sushi/teriyaki fillings. I got the spicy tuna, with cabbage, carrots, cucumbers, avocado slaw, rice, and black pepper teriyaki as my sauce. It was really a giant sushi roll. It was delicious and I loved the first couple bites, but after a while I was kind of eh on the whole thing. But I also get that way with sushi, so surprise! 

I think next time I come here I'll get a teriyaki/hot protein so that it kind of ends up like a stone bowl wrapped up in a seaweed thing. 

Warning, it is on the expensive side. But if you think about it, you pay $13 for a sushi roll with all this stuff, and the portions here are bigger so I guess it adds up

I kind of have a love-hate relationship with Target.

I get excited to go there and could spend hours buried in the aisles, but then the spending can get out of control.  

They recently renovated this store and now they have a grocery section, which is awesome, although it did take some time getting used to the new layout.

Times NOT to go to this Target:
- 5-6 pm on weekdays.  Just trust me on this.  
- Sunday mornings/early afternoons, aka Whenever Church Gets Out.  

The lines get really long and unfortunately the staff doesn't adjust well to a sudden influx of customers the way other stores around town does.  

That being said, this Target is less than a mile from my house, so I love the convenience.  The staff is always quick to ask if we need help finding anything (which can get a little annoying the 4th or 5th time, but it's better than being ignored when you really DO need help).

The donuts are delicious, I loved that they were made to order style, they come out so fresh! You have to eat the donuts when they're warm! It's so good! I went with two friends near closing time and it was pretty busy so I would suggest going earlier to avoid the end of the day crowd. There are thousands of ways you could customize the donuts, I love that there are so many options. Great place to come!

Liked the vibe and decor of this place. Friendly bartenders, amazing beer & wine selection and a wide variety of new american tapas..if I lived here, I would go to Tria at least once a week.  Loved that it was right across the street from my hotel- made it so easy to go and grab a glass of wine and a small plate while waiting for my friends to get ready back at the hotel.  Reminds me of a couple great wine bars in San Francisco that I love.

Oh Karma how I love and miss you! Be prepared to wait for your order. Again, is it me or is everything slower in Florida?! Lol. Had the best green juice, acai bowls, and oatmeal cookie! The avocado toast was no big deal though, I make it better at home. That's the only thing I'd skip next time. I loved the atmosphere and decor. Staff was friendly. I wish there was a location in NY!

The libertine is a fun little gift of a place. Walk in and dunk behind the curtain and let the fun begin. The services has always been top notch, even when the place is packed. Every drink is hand crafted to order the ole school way. The use of egg whites has always been such a foreign concept to me, but the cocktail masters blend the drinks to such perfection, this seems to now be the norm. 
The wine list is well developed and has great by the glass affordable options.(The super Tuscan rocks!)
The food items I have enjoyed are the artichoke fritters. First 2 times they rocked. Last time they were a fail. The flavor was missing, and they were a bit soggy. I will try again, as it may have been an off batch. The deviled eggs are such a fun addition. I love the 3 different flavors and the presentation.
My favorite thing that is now missing from the menu is the bacon popcorn. It was so addictive that I could not stop eating it. Please Please Please add this as a regular menu item!!!! 
One thing to be aware of is there is only one bathroom per sex,  so be prepared to wait a few minutes on a busy night.

Came here last night for sushi with the ladies.
This place always has great service - from the moment you come in, throughout the meal while the waiters check in on you & at the end when they greet you goodbye.
We got the chicken pad thai, volcano roll, salmon avocado roll and the green dragon roll. We were so hungry we ended up ordering a crazy salmon roll as well!
Note: only the special roll comes with a salad
The pad thai had a Chinese flair since they added zucchini and mushrooms which you do not see in traditional thai. This made the pad thai a bit watery but still tasty. Since I love veggies,  I can't complain.
The sushi rolls were perfect - fish was fresh and the sauces were on point!
We also had green tea and a small salad to share.
The total came out to $24 split 3 way. A bit on the pricier side but that's normal for dinner time. Their lunch special is a steal though - I highly recommend that!
Their decor is very modern and bright - check out their outdoor seating too!

OMG- another fab brunch place to add to my list of favorites and add to my waistline. A group of us came here after the Broad street run. The atmosphere was vibrant with open windows and, fun music playing through out. They had a fun selection of beers and brunch drinks ( belinis, bloody marys, etc). The table agreed that the food was great. The banger sandwhich and goat cheese omlet I split were so good. I sampled the burger which was delicious. The disco fries are a must! cheese, gravy, ham and a fried egg on top. This place defintiely loves it's eggs but that's ok with me:) Our waitress was awesome also. After working until the early hours the night before she was still pleasant and prompt. If I were you, I'd add Pub and kitchen to your brunch list for sure!

I really dig the military theme that this place exudes and how friendly and comfortable the location feels, even when things get packed for a game. They've got pretty sweet merch, too, if you want to commemorate the experience in the form of a sweatshirt or hat and provide free advertising. But this place does not need free advertisement because it's got delicious food, awesome service, and cool vibes to have built a reputation for itself. The servers are usually pretty hot, but also pretty helpful and seemingly down to earth. My favorite menu items are the veggie plate with chicken, the home made chicken tenders, and my friends love the fish tacos. If was all in on living in Tucson or had spent my undergraduate years here, I would definitely try to join the elite mug club. Otherwise us plebeians must sip our beer out of regular glasses.

I can't believe I haven't been here yet!  I had no idea how great this place was.  My friend and I enjoyed listening to some great music, and enjoyed great local drink options.  I had a sangria with basil and blackberry - it was excellent.  I love how there's a menu for each color of wine.  The bartender was informative, talking through what we would enjoy with us.  Excellent local whiskey, gin, beer and wine, and the bar was so different and flavorful!  We had house made chips and guacamole, and amazing tacos with a bacon-wrapped, chili stuffed with ground meat!!  Such a delightful experience!!

I had been wanting to go to this place for what seemed like an eternity. It has this eclectic yet homey vibe. It's like being in the country if the country were in the city. Does that make sense? Anyway, very cool decor. Loved the hanging windows everywhere and the community table in the middle of the restaurant. The service was extra friendly and helpful.

Not that many options for vegetarians here. Even less for vegans, but what they do have is pretty darn good. I went with my carnivorous boyfriend and he ordered Dave's smoked burger but subbed in the pork patty. He wasn't that impressed with the flavor though. I couldn't have enjoyed my dinner more though. I ordered the veggie black bean burger sans cranberry sour cream and put it on a pretzel bun. The patty did fall apart a bit while I was eating it, but the flavor was good. I also had the Pomegranite tea with pearl pomegranite, mint and simple syrup. The flavors were delish and just what I needed to ring in summer.

There are only so many ways I can saw wow.  From now on, I will question anyone who says "Blah blah blah has my favorite burger..." with "Have you been to Village Whiskey?" Because it's really that good. It's an all around phenomenal burger.

Dan and I had lunch here last week. It was a beautiful day, and Village Whiskey has some great outdoor seating.  They run tables along the wall like most places, but they have a bit more room than normal and an awning to provide shade.  We didn't step inside, but I'm sure it has a nice atmosphere.  The service during our whole meal was good; I'd be surprised to find anything less at a place like this.  

True to its name, this spot has an incredible selection of whiskey.  We didn't partake, but I'd like to at some point.  The beer list is decent, even though everything is one or two more dollars than it should be.  There are about six draft beers that rotate, along with a decent bottle list, including about ten large format bottles.  We split a 25oz bottle of red and white for $25, which isn't bad at all.  This Dogfish Head beer is a a whit aged in pinot noir barrels.  I really love it.

We both went with the burger.  There's an option to get a $24 burger with blue cheese, bacon and foie gras on top.  It sounds like overkill to me.  I went with the regular burger with blue cheese.  When it came out, I didn't like the looks of the burger.  Large chunks of blue cheese topped a patty that looked larger than a hockey puck.  I thought this huge patty was ridiculously oversized.  It only took one bite to change my mind.  To start, the burger was more tender and juicy than any other I've had.  Second, the ground beef was so lightly packed that it was almost barely formed.  This gave the meat great texture, and was why the patty seemed so large.  The burger was perfectly cooked and seasoned.  The blue cheese was a fantastic addition; it's quickly becoming my favorite cheese for burgers. 

The burgers don't come with any sides, so we put in an order of fries.  We decided to splurge and order the duck fat fries topped with Sly Fox cheddar sauce and braised short ribs.  It's a bit of overkill.  It's also delicious.  Every part of this side dish is well executed.  If you can forget that it's well over 1000 calories, you'll be able to enjoy these beefy cheddar fries.  To be honest, I think I'll order the plain fries next time.

Bottom Line: The burger here is amazing, and it's reason enough to visit.  It's a bit pricey, but that's what you should expect for the area.  If you eat meat, I highly recommend coming here.  A little more effort in the beer list is desired, but other than that Village Whiskey doesn't disappoint.  I look forward to my next visit.

I came back on a much quieter Sunday afternoon to pick up some birthday cookies for my sweet friend Melony!

The guy helping me was super nice and helpful! I tried a rainbow cookie and some cremes they use, and picked out some wonderful goodies. Rainbow cookies and a black and white cookie is what I picked!

This bakery is adorable and I love how they are local. They grew up in New York and the guy that helped me use to pick up these cookies on the way to school when he was young. 

The desserts are so so good. They also make customized cakes. They also have pre-made cakes that you can come in and request they decorate for you. 

So happy to finally have a fresh local bakery in the area!

I love this apples bees!

I have noticed that they seem to be more on top of there game when it is during the evening (thing end of dinner and after dinner crowd) and things are packed, than during the day when things are slower. Not sure why that is, but its true.

The staff here is friendly, and love to make conversation with you. The food is up to applebee's standard and the bar is always packed out. I have yet to have an unpleasant experience here, and we've been eating here over the course of four years.

Where do I start?

Limoncello has always been a staple for a great Italian meal. I have eaten here numerous times for various different occasions. Always a busy place but well managed.

I will start with the food. I have ordered just about everything on their menu and they always seem to exceed my expectations. My favorite meal by far is the Chicken and Sausage Scallopini. 

Cocktails and other adult beverages from the bar are always made properly, not too strong and definitely not watered down.

I love going to dinner in West Chester but Limoncello always seems to capture the perfect atmosphere. Sometimes being too busy is a turnoff, but in the case of Limoncello it is a pleasant surprise and makes it feel as if you are apart of the town and at the place to be. I always plan and make a reservation and I have not once waited more than two-three minutes to be seated with my reservation of course. Some restaurants you still end up waiting like everyone else but not in the case of Limoncello.

Service is always an A+++, for the last 4-5 times that I have eaten dinner at this establishment, I have had the waiter Marty. He always provides fast and attentive service. I can always tell he has a lot of tables but somehow manages to be on top of all of them. This man is a workhorse and I always tip him generously and is probably the main reason that I always return.

4.5 stars because a the server guy, who only served us once before, remembered that we asked for Splenda a month ago!!  Talk about great service!  If the bathroom was clean, it would be 5 stars.  Love love LOVE the beignets and cafe au lait here!!  We definitely prefer Morning call over Cafe du Monde...After all, Morning Call is the original!

We've eaten here often in the past. Mom loves their fish tacos. Hubby and I bring her here to get them. We really used to like this place a lot, but it keeps going downhill, but I don't know why. It's a shame.

The fruit salad (pico de gallo) with chile and lime is pretty good. The handmade corn tortillas are made fresh. 

I hope they get back to their better days.

I really loved the concept of this establishment. Knowing its reputation, I made sure I arrived early enough to gap a parking spot. I was seated at the bar and it took me awhile to make my decision on brunch. This eclectic spot with vintage furniture and decorations, coffee and alcohol bar was a unique spin on the breakfast place.  I started the mall with cold brew coffee and the Spanish manchergo and grapefruit dutch baby pancake with smoked goose city ham.  The pancake looked light but it turned out to be filling.  Service was very prompt and precise. The process are high relative to Chicago, which was a surprise.  $25+ for one is steep!  Perhaps this is a niche offering in Indianapolis but the price doesn't seem to match food provided.  I'd probably not revisit again as there are always other options to try, however if I lived in the city, it probably be worth another visit for an adult beverage.

I had lunch here recently. I ordered the Korean tacos and they were some of the best tacos I've ever had. Someone I was dining with recommended that I have them double wrapped and that was a VERY good idea because they were so juicy and saucy was hat it was a bit messy (even with the double wrap). Lunch was low-key, it's not a very busy place that time of day. My server was okay: nothing bad, but nothing to write yelp about . If you go--get the Korean tacos! Warning: they're for spice lovers!

I'm currently sitting in Henry's on East munching on the California Turkey sandwich as well as sipping on Henry's coffee. Yes, I know, coffee and a turkey sandwich might not sound like the most appealing duo, but for me it's working out nicely.

Henry's on East is quickly becoming my go-to coffee shop/all-day hangout, edging out that chain coffee shop that must not be named. As a current job-searcher, I need some place I can go with my laptop that has comfy seating, delicious coffee, and doesn't care that I stay there all day typing away. The atmosphere at Henry's is wonderful, and the fact that they give me free refills on my coffee makes me a happy, job-seeking camper. 

I haven't gotten too crazy with my coffee or food selections, but I just have a hunch that anything I get here would be spot on delicious. Oh, did I mention they put sprouts on their sandwiches? I love sprouts. I love Henry's on East. Okay, back to job-searching now.

Nice place that I have visited twice so far. The first time I was solo, but the second time, I brought my boyfriend and a friend. For this meal, I ordered their caprese salad, which was mozzarella and parmesan cheese and grape tomatoes nestled in a bed of arugula. There was some pesto on the mozzarella, and the salad was complemented with two pieces of sourdough bread. I enjoyed spreading the mozzarella over the bread and made a mini sandwich with the rest of the arugula and tomatoes. For my main course, I had their cavatelli pasta with spinach, pesto, pine nuts, and chopped up butternut squash with a sprinkle of parmesan cheese. I loved this dish, as the pesto (which I love) coated the cavatelli nicely and the pine nuts gave it a good crunch. Fair portion too. I actually had to take at least half of it home, and it was good for late evening. My boyfriend had a lobster roll that came with a side salad and told me his meal was wonderful. My coworker enjoyed her crabcakes with salmon immensely. We finished off the night with some drinks. I had their Tryst drink, which was strawberry with vodka, and my companion had Walk on the Pier and a Tryst. Boyfriend had Whiskey Sour. Now, I'm not much of a drinker, so it was a bit strong for my taste, but I enjoyed the strawberry flavor! Great place to go people watch in the middle of Beach Drive! If the weather is nice, I strongly recommend eating Al Fresco to enjoy being part of the scene!

I've seen this business pop up on various food ordering apps and thought we'd give it a try. It's not far, so to save the delivery fee and driver tip, we ordered for pick up. The man answering the phone was a bit difficult to understand both because of a thick accent and a loud fan on his end, but I asked if there was a special with pizza and wings. We ordered the "pick 3" that includes a medium 2 topping pizza, 10 wings and a poutine. We also added a 3 piece of fried chicken (comes with fries) and were given 4 free cans of pop. Total came to just under $34. 

Pizza was simple but had a good crust and decent sauce. Wings were not breaded but fried crispy. Poutine was ok, and could have used more cheese. Fried chicken was a pleasant surprise - seasoned well and crispy without being oily. Didn't love that it came in a greasy paper bag though.

The place itself is small and in an older plaza. I'm not sure I'd get anything "fancy" here, but the basics were ok. Didn't blow me away, but I didn't hate it either.

If you enjoy being entertained by live performance this is the city's biggest festival! You will laugh you will cry you may get weirded out but it will be entertaining! Get tickets for a private show and explore one of the many stages hidden around Edmonton or see the street performers near strathcona market. Lots of food vendors near the main outdoor stage if you get hungry and beer gardens if you need to rest your feet. Also wander the street market to see some local artests, jewellers and other nicknacks! Luckily it's spread out over 10 days so you have a chance to catch a few shows and take it all in! I love this fest and look forward to it every year. You can also go online to Edmonton fringe fest to see recommendations and show times. Happy fringing!!

Visited last night for restaurant week. As it's aptly named, they are known for their prime rib and wow it was melt in your mouth delicious! 

Aside from the ignorant hostess (short blond hair, older woman) and the lack of appropriate # of servers for the amount of people, we thoroughly enjoyed our dinner with family and a friend (party of 5).

Our waiter Vinny was fantastic and very social BUT spread way too thin which meant longer wait times on drinks, no serving spoons for the family style served mashed potatoes and string beans for the table and forever to get coffee to go with our desserts (coffee arrived after everyone was done). Our tip appropriately complimented Vinny as a great server, it isn't his fault they don't have enough wait staff. Monday (the following day) they had over 500 people coming with only 8 servers staffed. Think about that. Last night there were approximately 350 diners, and it showed in attentiveness of the wait staff. Again, NOT the servers fault at all, Vinny was great. 

They have a full service bar and extensive wine list but it is also BYOB so we enjoyed our favorite wines. 

Parking is ugh... it is Center City, so parking garages are expensive and street meter parking is an adventure to find. However I am in love with the new meterup app the city of Philadelphia has instituted and it's only $3 an hour for meter parking that you can add time to from your smartphone. We also found out that handicap tagged cars get an hour free parking on Sundays in the city! 

Restaurant is beautiful, well laid out, has a nice ambiance with a piano player (who takes tips), upper scale normal pricing approx $60 per person, dressier than a casual place so dress up and go have an amazing night out in the city starting with a wonderful prime rib dinner.

A kid, or an adult that is a kid at heart would love this whimsical dreamy dessert haven. These are the phrases that comes to mind when I envision Creole Creamery. The exterior and interior aesthetics scream antique candy/malt shop and it smells awesome once you step foot inside. When I walk inside, I immediately look at the giant chalkboard that list the current flavors. Note: Some flavors are subject to change. On my last visit I tried the Creole Strawberry Sundae-- Fresh strawberries served over a mound of our famous creole cream cheese ice cream topped with whipped cream, a cherry, and a wafer, which came in a huge sundae glass, topped with dips of creole cream cheese flavored ice cream, fresh strawberries and graham cracker. It looked too cute to bite into so I made sure to take a photo and upload it first. Then I took the first bite and seen rainbows. I am very dramatic but I like--well--love Creole Creamery and wish I lived down the street as a kid vs. Dairy Queen. I feel robbed. If you want, they offer samples to taste and try different unique flavors like Lavender Honey, which is also good. Next time, I am going to try either another sundae or Ice Cream Sampler--
--4 mini scoops or  6 mini scoops--so that I can try more awesome frozen goodness. 
Oh, and bring cash, this place is true to tradition, no fancy cards to swipe in this place.

I felt a little bad about the experience for the people I was with, because one friend's burger wasn't cooked to order and when you ask for ranch, they give you their creamy horseradish dressing with poppy seeds. I liked the dressing, but that ain't no ranch! My other friend tried to order steak and they were out... so I felt bad about choosing this restaurant lol. 

HOWEVER! I order the seitan tenderloin and was happy with it! It can't beat an actual tenderloin, but I don't do meat anymore! I LOVED the habanero hellfire sauce and intend to come back for that when I crave spicy wings. The fries were crispy and delicious!

I love Greek food! Zorba's tavern is BYOB has a lovely patio area where you can people watch while enjoying the atmosphere. (Be careful with the mosquitos; they'll eat you alive out there!) 

We enjoyed the "charcoaled sampler for two" for $37 (pork kabob, chicken kabob, marinated chicken breast, two rack lamb chops, homemade sausage and gyro meat) which is the perfect thing to share and try a little of everything. Although it was delicious I couldn't get over the very high cost of the meals- they will run you $15-$25 on average per entree, and the ambience/quality did not really match the price.

Total Wines is like I've died and gone to Heaven! Great selection of wine, beers, liquors, spirits, and specialty items. Staff is overwhelmingly friendly and always goes out of their way to help or make you feel welcome. I love wandering through here and discovering new treasures to try. Samples are fun, as well as some special gift items they offer. In addition to the great stock, and fabulous staff, the prices are extremely fair, bordering on low. I am continuously impressed when I visit!

A habit is slowly forming between the boyfriend and I that we'd go out for Saturday lunch meal, and amongst our favorite food had to be burgers. After going out for PYT at the piazza and loving it, we decided it's a bit far for us to go there every week, so after looking around Yelp, we settled for 500 Degrees. It earns point from me just by naming it a numeric symbol.

Outside the door, there's a burger of the week sign with some interesting concept burgers.  Upon entering and after reading the menu, I asked for a "Heat Lover Combo" and I repeated myself 3 times because apparently the server has never heard of the Heat Lover before and I have to point at the sign right next to the cash register and tell him I want that burger in a combo. In which he told me that the special burgers don't come available in a combo. Huh? Is it so difficult to put that in a combo deal like all the regular burgers they have here? (After reviewing their facebook page, apparently a lot of burgers of the week comes in a combo pack, so I don't know what the problem was)

Anyway, after ordering that and a 500 burger combo with mushrooms, we sat at the well lit dining room and started analyzing. The burgers were quite superb, perfect sized, good soft buns with a juicy, soft, meaty patty that goes perfectly with the cheddar. The special sauce in the 500 burger is tasty and the bacon added some crispiness. The grill has slightly charred the outside and give it a smokiness that's ever so alluring. The special sauce and a lite dijon mustard is also served at the table that undoubtedly enhance the flavor of any burgers.

The Heat Lover burger has a lovely pickled jalapeno peppers on top that tickle the taste buds but not enough to give you an intense heat. The spicy fries and the truffle fries are also a bit weak in flavor, so was my chocolate shake. I wonder if the fries can benefit with just a tad more salt and pepper or the flavoring it promised. The fries are also a bit on the soft side. 

The burger outweighs the bad, with a well lit place and an affordable menu, it's still very much worth coming back again. I'll definitely come back a few more times for weeks to come.

Seriously, this place is a gem. I love every inch of this store. From the kitschy knickknacks to the handmade silver charm that'll "love you to the moon and back"--there's a gift for everyone here.

Perfect Christmas, Birthday, Anniversary or "Just Because" Saver... you'll always find something for your someone here! Even just to stop by, it's even a great waiting room for spillover waiting people from surrounding restaurants! We had to wait for Bru Burger for like 45 minutes and we just shopped til we dropped! 

Whenever I need to get something for friends from out of town, I can't think of any other place (well, this place and Homespun..) But more so Silver in the City is my place to go! You can also bring your doggy there!!! MORE REASON TO GO AND FALL IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE.

I like Yats. I go there at least once a month. Is it a destination restaurant? No. Is it tasty, quick, and affordable? Yes!

They're a local chain with locations all over indy (and some locations in other cities/states). I haven't experienced a ton of variability between stores -- the food tastes basically the same, although the decor may change a bit.

I would characterize most of their food as stews over rice -- some kind of saucy entree poured over a plate of rice, served with tasty garlic bread. I love the bourbon chicken, but I'm not a fan of most of their other offerings -- the veggies taste canned, and I don't really like crawfish. I think they're using minute rice, or some other parboiled short grain rice -- I understand that it makes cooking it quicker and easier, but rice cookers are everywhere and not that expensive! I am a bit of a rice snob, so I really would appreciate the rice quality going up a bit -- but I don't think most folks would notice or care.

I'd recommend it for a quick lunch or dinner, and I am thrilled to see a local chain thriving. I wouldn't really go out of my way to eat there, but I think their food is tasty and convenient.

They have grenade cups, that wins in my book haha........It's a bar on Bourbon street, you know the deal. But since I don't drink, I do think the lil toy grenades and grenade cups are awesome. Others love their specialty drinks that I have been there with.

Perfect ambiance for a classy romantic date! 

We were able to snatch one of the coveted window lounge tables just a few days before the date because it was on Super Bowl Sunday. As it was the one evening a year that basically everyone else is eating wings and watching football, the establishment was relatively empty, which only added to the excellent ambiance. For one, it was calm and quiet. Also, the servers were extremely attentive and helpful since there weren't too many tables to wait on.

I would say that if I was rating just based on food, I'd give it a 4/5 because the main dishes were a bit saltier than preferred, and overall not overwhelmingly amazing for the price. However, one item I would recommend is the lobster mac & cheese, which came with delicious fat chunks of lobster. Other minor downsides to the dining experience were: the bar was out of pear liquor for the cocktail drink that we ordered so we had to find another drink, the server accidentally brought out the wrong appetizer for us initially (which seems pretty surprising since there weren't many customers), etc. All in all though, I had a lovely evening and enjoyed my meal regardless, and everyone was very pleasant!

Love this place.  We got our supply of gourmet panchetta, sopressata, mozzarella, and truffle pate, along with generous samples of the torrone and pecorino romano.  Service was fantastic, as always.  A must-try for any Italian meat purveyor.

Stopped by for lunch with my two 20 something daughters. Great selection of greens with interesting combinations. Too numerous to mention. Large salads which could easily shared.
I had a cup of curried lentil soup which had a mild heat and was delicious. The girls loved their salads
Clean well designed footprint
Highly recommended 
Slainte,

Not sure if I'll be back and I have to say I'm quite disappointed. I had seen this shop a couple times but never was there during open hours. So anyway, I had am opportunity to check it out so I stopped in. So, no greeting. Ok maybe try didn't see me. They had a nice selection and a cute setup. I adored their LBD section. I decided to try one on. But I guess some weren't pleased with how long I was taking in the dressing room (which wasn't even 10 mins). I overheard a conversation that seemed about how long I was in the dressing room.  It seemed a bit rude. When I stepped out a worker said, "O never mind"which made me awkward. I don't know I would love to go back.....we'll see. They had some really great pieces; they just need to work on their customer service.

Trident is never my first choice, but it is a solid back up.  They serve food late which is helpful when I am meeting The Man after a class that doesn't get out until 9:00.  It is always a convenient place being located right by campus but without the raucous atmosphere of University Ave.  I've worked my way through the menu and a lot is mediocre but there are a few stand outs.  Don't miss the fish and chips.  The fish is super crispy and the waffle fries are great (when they aren't soggy).  This is really the best thing on the menu.  If you are feeling in a soup mood, the clam chowder is solid.  The crabcake is pretty decent too and will remind you of the mid-atlantic coast.  Which brings me to... if you are Redskins fan, this is your home.  I used to work on a couple Redskins shows back in DC, so of all the NFL teams, I have a special place in my heart for the "burgundy and gold", underdogs that they are.  I love the atmosphere here for games.  There is something special about going to a bar dedicated to one team and everyone there is rooting together.  On another note, the owner Nelson is very involved in the community and has kind of been a fixture in Tucson forever.  If you are a Navy guy, you'll love Nelson.

We bought our 2007 Hyundai Sonata from Fred Beans.  Over the years my family and my husband's family have each bought many different cars - new and pre-owned - of different makes from Fred Beans.

Between them and Foster & Kardane (and we were friendly with the Kardane clan back in the '80's) they pretty much OWN the D-town automotive scene.

Competitive prices and salespeople who don't make you feel like a target.

Good repair work, too.

I'm sorry to hear that Sub S. had a bad experience.  Ours has been fine - and we still have and love our car 4 years later.

Herbies
 
I started a new job and I am located in Clayton. My boss and coworker took me out here for lunch a couple of days. It was called another name but not sure if I was a rebranding or if it is a totally new restaurant. 
 
The first day I went I had the special. A chicken sandwich French Fries and Salad. I opted out of the French fries but for some reason the server still sent them. There was a HUGE amount of them. Although I could not eat them all, the few that I did have were delicious. They were topped with real parmesan cheese. My sandwich was also great. It had cole slaw on it. At first I didn't think I would like that but it really did make the sandwich pop. 
 
The second time I ate here (in a week) I had the pesto Pasta with Shrimp. The shrimp was great. But I didn't really care for the noodles and pesto combined (although I really like pesto) just something about the mix of them all wasn't to my liking. My new boss got the shrimp and grits and he loved the...he ate them all. Now I wish I would have gotten that instead.

After much anticipation, I can finally check this one off my list.  Pizzeria Vetri was the Friday night destination for myself & three friends, for a low-key birthday celebration.  

Communal tables, and not too many at that.  Normally I hate communal tables, but this wasn't terrible - at least there are chairs instead of communal benches. A few places to sit around the "kitchen" (aka pizza oven).  A few outdoor tables as well, with heaters so they can still be utilized in the chilly autumn. No rezzies, so unless you come before 6, be prepared for a short wait.  And no great place to wait inside - we grabbed a drink from the bar (a small counter right as you walk in) and hugged the far wall where there's a small ledge, presumably for drinks, though if you stand in front of it like a bar, the people at the nearest table can't get out.

They have a pretty extensive beer list, including my favorite beer-in-cider-clothing, Anthem Hops Cider. (For those who don't know it - if you aren't a beer person but hate the sickly sweetness that too often ruins cider, Anthem Hops should be your new jam).  Unfortunately it's like $8.50, but it's so good.  A couple of wines and bottled or canned cocktails, but beer is definitely where they put their resources.

The gluten-freebie in our group got the wood oven salad and absolutely loved it - and it certainly looked delicious.  The other three of us split the arugula salad (a must-get), the Renato pizza (excellent) and the Salsiccia pizza (meh - it was fine, just didn't blow me away like the other stuff we had). As my one self-proclaimed pizza-connoisseur friend noted, their leoparding of the crust edges is perfect; but I agree with another yelper who thought the crust was soggy.  Doesn't kill the experience for me, just something to note.

Dessert was the fried dough (stop thinking about the negative nutritional value and just order it - hot, light, chewy, almost churro-like in taste, so delicious), and the cookie jar, which was sort of disappointing because all of the cookies are traditional Italian, as you would expect, but none of them were sweet and cookie-like in the way we uncouth Americans prefer.  

Best part of the whole meal: limoncello!  Order it. Sip it. Savor every moment.

Something around $80 including tip for everything for 4 people - not too shabby.  Will certainly be back for, if nothing else, more limoncello.

Yuk Yuk's is one of Edmonton's stand-up comedy venues, located in the Century Casino on the northside of the city. It's an intimate setting that opens right up into the slot machines, with a full menu & bar, cozy seating, and hilarious guest performances throughout the week, throughout the year. Good night out! #yeglove

I have fallen in love with Rescue Rittenhouse. My father had given my mother a gift certificate for Christmas 2010 (actually, I picked it out, he just paid and signed the card!) After months of not using it, she decided to let me have at it. At that time I'd been suffering from pretty severe anxiety disorders, and though I'm a beauty fanatic, I'd pretty much given up on any treatments that required me to sit still for longer than 15-30 seconds. With her encouragement I booked a manicure spur of the moment.

When I arrived later that day, I was soothed by the calming atmosphere, but not so much so that my shaking didn't come back once seated. I was given Ana Maria, and she is precisely what saved me! I warned her about my incessant need to shake something - most likely a leg - and to just yell at me if I was ruining her concentration and painting abilities. She assured me not to worry, and we immediately got to chatting. She was so friendly and personable that in the end, I had worried for nothing (like most things I worry about)! Ana Maria totally took my mind off my troubles while giving me the best manicure ever! 

Later in the summer, I went back for another manicure, and this time added a pedicure. I was twice as pleased! I also went in for a classic massage, again nervous about trying to keep my body relaxed for so long. Once again I was proven wrong about worrying! I was immediately put at ease by the masseuse - I want to say her name was Venus - and had an amazing, wonderfully relaxing massage.

I don't go here every time I want a mani/pedi as it is quite expensive, but when I have a special event (or just want a bit of pampering) I head straight to Ana Maria here at Rescue! And if I were to ever plan another massage, I'd be sure to book with Venus. Overall, every experience has been wonderful.

I used a comp yesterday to get my food to go. I ordered a taco salad and the meatloaf special it seamed to a very big deal to sub the mashed potatoes to French fries but I'm not sure why. Also, when I came back to pick up my food I was informed that there was no cilantro for the salad and it was chefs choice for the substitution. I have no clue what the chefs choice was, there was nothing extra. I love cilantro. I probably would have skipped this item had I been told when I ordered that there was none.

The meatloaf was very good. The salad was ground beef with a 1/2 a bag of crumbled chips on top. No avocado as I recall reading on the menu. 

I think this is 3rd time this place has changed names. I think it just needs to get a staff that works better with the waitresses and a menu that they can execute for take out as well as dining in.

Consider me underwhelmed.

Zack read that this place was on some "Best Breweries in the Country" list which I am starting to not believe. Had it bookmarked for months and finally stopped by before a show at Ardmore Music Hall (right across the street).

The place is big! No need for a tour, really, as you're right in the middle of the brewery "in-action," or at least that's what it feels like. It was fairly packed on a Friday night and it was loud. High ceilings. You know.

Zack and I shared a tasty burger ($10, with bacon, cheese, and fries). It was on the smaller side, but a steal for the price. The only problem? It was well-done. No room for requesting temperatures here, as they state on the menu "no additions no substitutions," which frankly always puts a sour taste in my mouth. We also enjoyed a cherry and grilled radicchio salad, which was interesting. Nothing about these items made me jump up and down, until we had dessert. 

The best part of the meal was the ice cream sandwich, which we (regretfully) shared four ways with our double date. Better to split in half, if you ask me!

As far as the beer goes: they don't do flights. I tried a few 4-ouncers, but didn't fall in love. If you live in Ardmore, I can see how this place would be super exciting. I thought it was A-OK.

This is one of my FAVORITE locations! I love the way the shop is set up. It's easy to browse and there is a lot of space to move around. They have such great deals! The clearance is my favorite! They have books, records, dvds, cds, comics and so much more! They also take items you may be getting rid of and give you money for them. I've never been offered that much for my old textbooks, but at least they offer that perk. This location has great customer service. The associates are always very helpful and friendly!

Recently I bought two dvds from here, when I got home one wouldn't work in any console I had. So I took it back, and it was no problem. I explained and had my receipt and the process was so easy. The associate that helped me was very friendly and nice. I like no hassle returns!

Came here with coworkers and had a blast. Everyone ordered alcohol so I asked the bartender to bring me the sweetest, most candy-like drink they had. He brought me the Don't Stop the Carnival drink and after everyone tasted it half the table ordered one as well. It was definitely the best sweet drink of the night. 

I've been before but it was so long ago I didn't remember anything and wasn't yelping back then. Luckily, we all ordered and shared food (my dream!) so I got to try a TON of things. 

I found I love some of their shrimp items, but not all. I actually disliked their Coconut Shrimp which is weird because I LOVE coconut shrimp almost everywhere. The New York Strip Steak had a good flavor but it was too rough for me. I forgot I prefer a different cut. The Pretzel Sticks were just not good to me. They were doughy inside and the dipping sauce was a sharp mustard that I couldn't stand. The grilled chicken tasted a little blackened, which I didn't enjoy. Otherwise it was good. The Key West Quesadilla tasted ok by itself but I know if I could've eaten the sour cream and salsa with it (forgot to ask my coworker for some) it would've been great. 

It was a great experience to have with my coworkers. I think the drinks were the best part of the night but the food was just ok. Nothing really special. Maybe we just picked the wrong things. 

To Try:
Beach Tacos
Island Kabob

Loved: 
- Chocolate Banana Colada
- Don't Stop the Carnival (alcohol) (fav)
- French Fries
- Grilled Blackened Shrimp
- Lava Lava Shrimp (with extra sauce!)
- Ice Cream with chocolate sauce 
- Island Rice
- Key West Quesadilla (with sour cream and salsa)
- Mango Salsa

Ok: 
- 5 o'clock Somewhere (alcohol)
- Corn
- Green Beans
- Grilled Chicken Breast
- Rum Runner (alcohol)
- Sauteed Island Lime Shrimp
- Shrimp Trio
- Strawberry Margarita
- Volcano Nachos

Disliked: 
- Cilantro Lime Cole Slaw
- Crispy Coconut Shrimp
- Conch Fritters
- Horseradish-Orange Marmalade
- New York Strip Steak (medium)
- Pretzel Sticks
- Yukon Gold Loaded Mashed Potatoes

This is a nice park on the Westside of Tampa Bay that allows views of the Tampa skyline and an enjoyment of fishing, boat launch, picnic pavilions, pier, and a water play area for the kids.  Also, during your visit you can enjoy eating at Taste of Boston.

Although small, this park packs a punch in beauty and fun.  During our visit we strolled around a manicured lawn with lovely trees with periodic views of the bay.  Towards the boat ramp we were able to walk out over the water to watch the boating and fishing, all with a view of Tampa.   Back away from the water was a play area that slides, obstacles for climbing, and other playful activities for kids.  The place had a small water park that sprayed, spouted, and dumped water for those wanting to cool off in the sun.

If you are looking for a fun place to take the family for relaxing fun that is not too far this is a good choice.

Quick, delicious and nice sit down Thai place. It's right on 202, in the corner of a shopping center.  We arrived around 4:30 and there was no one there, but by 5 it was quickly filling up. I loved the overly colorful and Thai decor. The veggie rolls were just OK. The pad see ew was really great and flavorful. My mango curry with tofu and shrimp was really flavorful and sweet, with a touch of spice and a side of rice. I liked that the sauce was nice and thick, and the portions were huge, so I wish either they gave more rice or a little less food so there was even proportion of each. I also liked their simple and straightforward menu. Would defintely recommend and come back. Also, it is BYOB!

Tria was a good choice for my Friday night dinner with a friend. They have nice, small sharing plates at a pretty reasonable price. BUT, our waitress decided to memorize our order, and then brought us a dish that we didn't order. We told her that she made a mistake, and she actually still charged us for the dish that we never asked for!

Besides this blunder, the food was fine. The inside was a bit dark and small. I know a lot of people love this place, so my experience might have just been an outlier, but I think it is worth mentioning.

I went, I saw, I ate.It was great.One of my 1st, not my last .It 's so hard for me to see or get to Food trucks, when you can get Soo many in an area, like to try stuff. I went with my parents, think my mom & I loved it more!! 
I tried the crepe place, Apple cinnamon crepe-quite delightful.The Zsa's Gourmet Ice Cream & was it a treat!!!? Only thing I wish, could their cups be any Smaller- For $3.00 -wow!!! But the flavor was fabulous!!! 
I didn't get to try tacos or pizza, since one of my party , not mentioning names rushed to get in restaurant to eat..wanted to try street food!! Next time-Just going to with my mom!! 
Did get to see the Yelp table & infamous Michelle, spun the wheel & won Yelp stick(chapstick) .Cool & fun night!!! Can't wait for the next one...

I love all of the Bailey's restaurants so was very excited to see the new concept in the old space. The decor is absolutely beautiful. It felt warm and inviting but also very modern and fun. We started our meal with the crab cake and the corn dogs. I was a bit surprised to see a crab cake appetizer with only one crab cake. I think it would have been better to have two smaller crab cakes to make it easier to share (it is an appetizer). However, the flavor of it was very good. The corn dogs were also good, but the portion size felt very off to me. It was served with five corn dogs, but they were almost the size of my palm. This required us to use a knife to eat them, so then the breading was falling off, making it somewhat strange to eat. I would have liked to see this served differently. For our meals, we both ordered the jambalaya. I enjoyed the sausage and tiny shrimp in the dish and felt it added some much needed texture. I found myself seeking those bites out and stopping when they were gone. I was surprised at the dish it was served in. It essentially came out in a boat instead of a bowl, which I felt was an odd choice. Our server, while a nice person, was not very helpful in terms of recommending items on the menu. For a new restaurant, I wanted to hear the house recommendations or customer favorites so far. They also went missing for about thirty minutes after we were served our main dishes and we had to flag someone down to get our check. I really wanted to love this restaurant but it fell a little short of my expectations. The food was good, but not as good as I was expecting for the price, and service was inconsistent. I will probably give it another shot since I love the Bailey's restaurants and think the New Orleans inspired cuisine is something our city needs, but am not in a hurry to return.

Alright, it's a Dunkin' Donuts, but who doesn't love a donut?
I like the bavarian creme best.  I have to say that I'm not happy with the amount of creme in the donut, it's like a tiny dab that I have to take 2 bites from each direction to get to it.  And it's the star of the donut!

The coffee is good.  Dunkin' coffee has always been really good.  That's why they sell it in the store too!  It's that good!

But, it's a Dunkin' Donuts, it's definitely consistent with any other Dunkin' Donuts.  But, it's convenient and it's not $5 for a cup of coffee!

I have a certain love/hate relationship with Bailey's Range. It has a lot of positive qualities, but there's also plenty of negatives. I've been here twice with the beautiful wife, so it's time to write a review. Rather than writing some gripping story, let's just hit some points. I'll also say that this could have just as easily been a 4 star review. But for the price, I'll keep it at three.

The Good:
1) We've only been here in the evening for dinner, but service has been really good. We've also sat upstairs both times (more about that later). We also appreciated a visit by Gene Bailey (manager and brother of owner Dave), where we were able to give some feedback

2) The two burgers that I've had (PB&J (pesto, goat cheese, tomato jam on a bison patty) and the Ozark (Ozark mushrooms, caramelized onions, and goat cheese) have both been great. Lots of lots with a good amount of toppings

3) The flavor of the shakes -- we've had the Irish Coffee (delicious) and the Sweet Sweet Bacon (bourbon, candied bacon, salted
caramel ice cream). If you're a fan of Pulp Fiction, you'll remember Vincent commenting about the $5 milkshake. Do they put bourbon in this one? Oh yes they do. And is this a good milkshake? Nay, it's a a pretty fucking good milkshake

4) The beer list -- they're keeping it mostly local and there are some excellent beers on tap

5) The house made pickles and catsup, the fries, the smoked onion rings -- I enjoyed all of them

The "not so good":

1) Price -- especially if you enjoy alcoholic beverages, you can rack up some stupid bills. The two times we've been there we've ended up with hefty bills (with tip, over $90 each time). I guess if you're a "let's split a burger, an order fries, and have one soda each" type of couple, you'll be able to walk out of there for $20. But, you're not much fun either. So live with that.

2) The consistency of the shakes -- I'd put the Irish Coffee shake up there with anything that Kota or the Fountain offers, but at Bailey's Range, they're just too thin. I know that Kota bought some uber shake machine, and while I'm not buying one for them, at some point, they should upgrade

3) The cheese curds -- I like cheese curds, but admittedly, I expected fried cheese curds. Instead, these are fresh. So Wisconsinites, you've been warned.

4) The rest of the alcoholic drink menu -- just haven't been a fan of anything the beautiful wife has ordered. For instance, The Bermuda is pretty much a Dark & Stormy with passion fruit nectar. But as presented, all you tasted was the passion fruit. Other drinks tasted more fruity/light, but then again, when you've gotten used to drinking mixtologist concoctions all the time, it's probably my palate.

5) The Carolina burger (topped with smoked pork shoulder,
house bbq sauce, sweet & spicy slaw) was so drenched in BBQ sauce that you couldn't taste anything else. The sauce was wonderful, but if you really want this burger, get the sauce on the side so you can moderate the amount you put on.

I really want to love Bailey's Range -- but that doesn't mean that I hate it. More that I was hoping it would be a place where we'd go on a Tuesday night when we don't feel like cooking. Instead, it feels more like a "we'll come here once a month."

This is a great hotel! They are priced affordably with large rooms and very comfortable beds!  You don't have to worry about getting in your car and looking for parking because its just a few blocks from the French Quarter! 

The front desk staff was VERY accommodating and kept the afternoon complimentary buffet open for any late comers (oops!). The best part of this hotel? They let my dog stay too, no questions asked! He loved it just as much as I did!

Thank you Drury, I had a wonderful stay!

Finally came to the Garden Bakery Restaurant this past weekend with Grandpa, hubby, and my lil' guy after his last Lil' Oilers Learn to Play session.

Grandpa was a bit hesitant at first because we've got him hooked on All Happy next door but I assured him my faithful Yelpers and their recommendations would not lead us astray.

We came upstairs and got right down to business.

First of all, there has definitely been some love and care put into updating the restaurant.  I was amused at the two ceiling panels - one with sky wallpaper and the other with Xmas lights strung across it - definitely my kind of place!

We ordered Green Onion Cake, rice, Beef Brisket Chow Mein (crunchy), Won Ton Noodle Soup, Fresh Fruit Mango Bubble Tea (x2), and Beef Rice Rolls (score)!

First of - everything came out fast, hot, and delicious.  SERIOUSLY good green onion cakes.  The pork wontons with shrimp in the soup were among the most flavourful I have ever had.

The fresh fruit bubble tea kept my 6 year old happier than a clam.

My husband was VERY happy that he could order rice rolls at a non Dim Sum time (though he did say he prefers Jumbo's but these were still dang good).

The beef brisket chow mein was delish.

Basically everything was AWESOME.  There was a slight miscommunication in that I wanted to order an additional bowl of just the pork won tons with hot chili oil and what came as a bowl of won ton soup but still sooo good.

Oh and total?  It was under $60 to boot!  

Seriously amazing - should've come here sooner!

This place delivers quickly to south Tampa.

I ordered online and had hot pizza and wings in my home within 25 minutes.

We tried a thin crust pizza (really thin) and a regular pizza.  I thought the thin crust was fairly tasteless, but my husband preferred it.  I didn't find the pizza especially remarkable, but it wasn't offensive either.

The wings are pretty awesome, though.  Very crispy despite the trip from Channelside to south Tampa.  I'm glad I got the sauce on the side so I could add it as needed.  I didn't love their bleu cheese dressing.  The celery was very crisp.

Can I give you 30 stars?  My tour guide was Mark. I want on the French Quarter tour. I bought the living social deal. $22 for 2 people. What a deal!  I would pay full price for this tour ANY day. 

We were a small group so my tour guide gave us the option to personalize certain elements. What did we want to see?  He gave us recommendation for bars and restaurants. And wow, did he know what he was talking about!!!!  

I loved that the guide not only showed us historical places but he gave us tons of historical tidbits and background. He was funny and informative. Don't consider another company. 

He even showed us so many great artists!  Wow.

Very standard fast food fare with sit down service.  Clean and spacious place with attentive staff.  Quick service with a smile.   The original Cracker Barrel Restaurants were just in the south along interstate highways.  The chain has been sold and expanded but has retained its southern, kitschy roots.  You can get grits, southern fried steak, biscuits and gravy, etc.  They all have a corny gift shop as you enter and rocking chairs ( for sale and made in China) on the porch.  Food is pretty "meh" but you get a consistent product from restaurant to restaurant.
Good for groups and kids.  Place is big so junior can lose it or start a food fight and no one will care!
Tends to be a favorite of older folks because of the value.  Not a place for free range chicken or hummus on pita!  Hipsters should stay away!  Food more like a Walmart with okay food.  Menu is Paula Deen light with recipes with lots of tasty but artery hardening ingredients.  If you like country and western music, you will love this place!

Carnival does a great job with their cruises. My husband and I enjoyed our cruise vacation. We embarked on a journey aboard the Carnival Legend. Although the decor is not modern it didn't really bother us at all. All of the staff was friendly and personable.

Our steward Eka was amazing! He greeted us with our names each day I felt like he was my best friend! Too much? Well I love hearing everyone's story. Each person on this ship whether working or vacationing has a story and it's amazing how many people you can meet on a cruise. The dining room staff: Bernard, Sang, and Suana was also great! They catered to us every night and made us laugh. Bernard and Sang had great stories. Eli our cruise director was the best yet! He was hilarious and also personable. 

I could write 5 pages about the whole vacation but that's not a review it will be a blog post. 

I was very sad to leave the ship. It felt like home to me. I look forward to our future cruises with Carnival!

Went on the chocolate tour today with my mom after getting a living social deal and we had a lovely time! Even in the rain, walking around with the group of 15 hearing about Philadelphia and tasting delicious chocolate treats was very enjoyable! We met in Rittenhouse square and went to 3 bakeries (one that was gluten and dairy-free and one that was vegan), insomnia cookies and scoop Deville. We had a brownie, cupcake, cookie bar, cookies and an ice cream treat and everything was so delicious and decent portions (I was expecting smaller, very glad I skipped breakfast). 
I loved that the tour was very casual and allowed us time to enjoy the streets of philadelphia, buy additional treats at each stop and enough time to really enjoy each sample before leaving for the next stop. 
We probably walked between 1-2 miles total and this was the perfect amount!
My only cons for this tour were that the tour guide, although very pleasant, talked too much about Philadelphia history and not enough about the different stops on the tour. I also wasn't expecting for the tour to end almost a mile from where we started, this should at least be explicitly stated when purchasing tickets so people can plan accordingly.
Overall, we had a great experience and are definitely interested in going on one of the other tours (coffee or cupcakes) in the future!

Wish there were more stars for this place!!! Love firecracker press!  First time in I had such a problem picking from all the cool stuff. 2nd time in I bought 200$ worth of amazing Christmas gifts. If you know letterpress, and I know letterpress, this is no normal store!  This amazing letterpress shop sells amazing gifts and even holds classes for anyone wanting to learn!! I took letterpress in college and I have to tell you there is an amazing collection of equipment and type at this place. Step back into time here when printing was an amazing craft, they do amazing wedding invites to fine art broadsides here. Check it out you will be impressed.

My friend and I went here about a month ago. The chicken was just okay in my opinion, I prefer a crispy crust like Hodak's, but my friend prefers batter so she loved it. I felt it was a little greasy and though it was supposed to be boneless, mine had little bits of bone in it. The sides were amazing, though. My friend got the mac and cheese and she let me try it- hands down the best mac and cheese I've ever had at a restaurant. I regret not getting it. My sides weren't memorable, but the biscuit was yummy.

We also had the handmade sodas- she got the elderflower one and I got a cream soda. We actually ended up switching because we preferred the other, but both were really good! 

Parking is street parking and the entrance is to the left side (it can be pretty confusing when you walk up). There's lots of seating inside and the bar top is a really cool, giant piece of wood. It's got a very log cabin-y feel to it. It looked like they had potential for outdoor seating but it was too cold the day we went so I'm not sure. 

As far as big-picture drawback: The service was just okay- we sat at the bar and the bartender was pretty busy. It seemed like he was a little annoyed with us sitting at the bar when there were plenty of tables around. Also, the prices are quite high for a fried chicken joint to plan accordingly (the 2 piece dinner with a side an biscuit is roughly $15). 

I would probably come back, but this time I would get the mac and cheese or the pimento grilled cheese (and sit at an actual table!)

We love coming here for our Acai bowls but today we got horrible service from the girl working calling out the bowls when they were done (young blonde girl with sloppy pony tail) she first called our name and gave us the wrong bowl but then called our name again with the right Island Bowl that we ordered. I then turned in the wrong bowl and she gave us the rudest attitude like it was our fault! I then said okay well here is the other bowl that we didn't touch at all, and she rolled her eyes and I still said thank you and she turned her back and ignored me. The customer next to me even looked at her in discuss with her nasty attitude!

I loved this mini-mall.
No it wasn't open on July 4 so I came here the next day and shopped at 10:30am. 
Very empty on a weekday and ok amount of sales.
A lot of exits and directions are very clear.
Very spacious and has a nice food court. I'm upset that I forgot to get a sushi burrito here haha.

We stopped in for a late lunch after boppin' around the Loop.
We've heard good things and have been meaning to check this place out but we love our regular pizza places so we rarely want to try any new ones.
We are so glad we did though since we loved everything!
We ordered our pizza split in half so that we could try both types of sauce....red and white.  One half was the Bronx Bomber and the other was the Billy Goat.  Both were really, really good!  I loved the Bronx Bomber the best....wonderful sausage!  
We will most definitely return and our waitress Ilana did an excellent job!!!

Layla's is right up there in my love for Nashville Honkey Tonks!  The music is similar to the rockabilly or brazilabilly music at Robert's and that is why I like it so much.  The traditional country music of lower Broadway is what really makes Nashville a great place to live an visit.  

The atmosphere is awesome. The small bar and even smaller bathroom makes it a great place to make new friends.  The crowd is unpretentious and the bartenders are super friendly.  I don't know what else you could want in a place -- good drinks, good music, and good service.  It is a trifecta of awesome!

I went back today with my family from CT and we all loved the food. CT has very bad takeout chinese food and not many authentic chinese restaurants. This restaurant is what I expect chinese food to be. There are lots of different curds and meat varieties. My favorite dish here is the jellyfish. I never tried jellyfish before coming here, but found out I love it. It's like soft calamari. We also ordered the singapore mei fun, which I believe Szechuan House makes the best I've ever tasted. There is real curry powder in it and you can taste it. Another thing we ordered was the duck with black bean curd in spicy sauce. The sauce was spicy and salty and oily and delicious. The duck had tiny bones in it which were hard to eat around, but I really loved the flavor and the way the duck was cooked. I still loved the dish. It was a good experience and we will come back. The waiters here are also very nice and polite.

You're telling me that I need to pay you extra if I DON'T finish my plate? So in some sort of twisted logic, YOU are paying ME to eat?!? Sign me up. 

My gf and I came here after spending the entire day at the beach sipping on water and snacking on fruit...yes, we were starving. Saki absolutely took care of that problem and then some. We started off with their fried scallop (nice texture) and beef negimaki appetizers. Next up we each had a plate of their hibachi (steak, chicken, shrimp) which was served with great tasting caramelized onions. The hibachi was great, worthy of being served as a standalone dish assuming they increased the portion. 

Now since we are both watching our weight we decided to only order about 14 sushi rolls! Yes, we love food. Would I pay full price for their sushi? No, but that's the beauty of AYCE, you're able to slightly sacrifice quality for greater quantity. I'm not saying they have "bad" sushi, but it wouldn't be too difficult to find sushi with better flavor and a better ratio of filling to rice. 

We finished the night off with their tempura banana and fried dough (think Thai doughnut). Both desserts were able to satisfy our sweet tooth without being overwhelmingly sweet. 

The service we received was pleasant. Our waitress was friendly, refilled our beverages and didn't seem to mind our vast amount of orders. If we ever manage to find ourselves in the area again, then I'm sure we'll come back.

The service at Chick-fil-A far surpasses most restaurants I've been to. I sat down at a booth and someone brought me my food AND asked if I wanted a refill. I can't even get some waitresses attention at actual sit down restaurants. I love their spicey chicken sandwiches with pepper jack, and I normally sub out the fries for their small salad. Yes you heard that right, I actually wanted a salad. Their avocado ranch dressing is made by the hands of god and is downright amazing and worth sacrificing my waffle fries.

I came to Dale's with my momma after an appointment. I'd never been that I can remember (while my dad claims our family has before). We were there for breakfast on a weekday morning. There were a decent amount of people in there - mostly elderly folk enjoying each other's company. 

I really liked the industrial vibe of the place. Apparently this look is new. The reno is working for them if you ask me! Great look! 

As someone who loves breakfast, but is both gluten and dairy intolerant,  I sometimes struggle to find good options. Dale's had plenty that I could try with a little adjustment - like ordering with no cheese. I tried an egg scramble - hash browns with mushrooms, tomatoes, and sausage, topped with an egg. It was supposed to have cheese as well, but I ordered it without.

It took a little longer than we would have liked for our food to come out. I was pretty hungry, so that could have been more of a 'time is passing less slowly than it feels' thing. That's fine! The food came out, and I immediately see cheese melted on my eggs. I made sure to send it back right away, while my mom began to eat her meal. They had to completely remake the order, so it took a bit to get it back the correct way. (I did enjoy the "NO CHEESE!!!" I heard someone yell in exasperation from the kitchen at my seat by the front door.)

When I did get the corrected order, it didn't look as good as that first plate I received. There seemed to be less eggs on it. I think they were just rushing to get it out to me and it showed a bit in the presentation. Not really a huge deal. I care more about the taste! But that wasn't that great, either. I really wanted to love it, but alas... The hash browns were more of a shredded potato layer, and it was a bit limp. It would've been better with just a little bit of crisp. The eggs were good! But when they were gone, that left the potatoes with what looked an awful lot like canned mushrooms and what I honestly believe was one sausage link, sliced super thin and mixed in to the dish. 

Overall, I wasn't impressed by the food. That said, I would give Dale's another shot in the future. My expectations of the experience, though, will be fairly mediocre moving forward. Maybe someday they'll change that for me! If so, I'll update my review. :)

The perfect place to hole up on a winter evening. The thought of Touch of Grass playing in the background and THE BEST old fashioned I've ever had in hand..... makes me almost wish it wasn't summer so I could curl up in the corner of this joint. As you can tell, I really love this place. We frequent it monthly, and we are never disappointed. GO!

tomato basil soup, omg delicious.

bbq chicken flatbread is good when I'm eating it but then I feel sick afterwards.

My bf loves the curry chicken but I'm not a big fan of any of Cosi's sandwiches.

This gym is cool and is in the middle of Channelside downtown. You must workout during the day Cuz after 500 pm it's crazy busy in there. The employees are mostly friendly but not overly friendly. I love all the options it has to work out. I love the free massage chairs for after my work out. Parking is a pain and is not very convenient.  Overall, I enjoy it and will continue to come to this gym during off hours.

Love this store although it's only been there a couple of years. With the hot sauce shop gone in Peddlers village this is a nice addition. A small shop with plenty to take in. As soon as you walk in the aromas of the spices hit you like a wall.  Although pleasing to me and many others it might not be your cup of tea. A definite gourmet of spices and great cooking ideas. I could not just choose one. They even have genuine extracts. Not just vanilla, but butterscotch, espresso and rum. The blend of spices and seasonings which many have testers. You can sniff and taste before you buy which is right up my alley. They have a decent selection of pepper spices, chilli powders from all over and even some gourmet curries. Pink salt if that's your thing to dried hot peppers to cinnamon. Their grilling rubs sound delicious. They are moderately to run of the mill price some are expensive depending on what you pick. But a grocery store can sell you a watered down version of curry powder for 5 bucks and less than 3 oz. Why not pay a little extra and get a damn amazing curry powder that has flavor. Definitely worth a stop in you never know what flavors await..

South Grand has many delicious good offerings; currently, my brother and I are trying as many as we can. This particular place was the next on our list. The restaurant was inviting but only a few tables were occupied on what should have been a busy Friday night. After dining there, my guess is because the service is not the best. It took a bit for someone to come over and take our drink order by the time they did, we were ready to order our food from an extensive menu. The menu has many great offerings for those who are vegetarian or love seafood along with other meat options as well. We tried the Shrimp spring rolls which were excellent. You get five of them for about $6 and it is the perfect amount for an appetizer. Our main meal arrived and it was delicious as well, though it was not quite enough to eat for my brother. He ordered one of the seafood items while I went for a vegetarian option. I ordered a Pad Sun Wen which was a perfect amount for me; I even took some home. The Thai iced tea is also delicious and was my favorite part of the whole trip. We never were asked if we wanted refills and the only time someone came by, was to drop off our food, drinks or the check. I did observe that this place seemed to do a lot of carry out and perhaps that is the way to go.

I came here for breakfast one morning. In the spirit of a true Honduran breakfast, I ordered baleadas and horchata (which is good at any time of day). I absolutely loved both of these. Tortillas really make the baleada, and these tortillas were the SHIGGIDY. My boyfriend, not a native baleada-eater, said the tortilla was his favorite part. And I found the horchata was simply amazing! Disclaimer: horchata has a different taste by country, but THIS is how horchata is supposed to taste and is how typical Honduran horchata tastes.

As the daughter of a Honduran woman, I have been to Honduras many times and have a true perception of authentic Honduras cuisine. All the dishes, exclusing non-Honduran dishes (sopes, Mexican tacos) look 100% authentic. And I would bet that they are delicious!

Notes:
DON'T expect anything fancy. This restaurant has the essence of hole-in-the-wall restaurants. 
DO expect to catch up on your soap operas while dining.

They don't have almond milk, so I've stopped coming here for coffee, but their espresso is pretty good on its own! 

Gelato flavors are unmistakeable -- a citrus-flavored gelato will be perfectly citrusy, a nutty gelato will be perfectly nutty. Gelato lovers will find heaven here, although I might prefer their affogato because I'm never satisfied with ice cream portions ever.

I love this grocery store.  The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because I cannot leave with everything I need on my shopping list.  

I first came about the Turnip Truck when I moved to the gultch.   I would go when I randomly forgot something at the store.  However, now I go at least twice a week for all of my meat purchases. 

I am my mothers daughter and very picky about the meat I buy.  I love when I buy the meat at TT it is packaged that day.  How much fresher can you get?!?

This place is awesome.  It the who experience that I give it 5 stars.  2 miles off main road you'll find this hidden gem.

Love all the locals that come here.

The sky is ridiculous.  Full of stars like you have never seen in your life!

Wine selection great!  Service was great!

My son had a buffalo burger and mashed potatoes came with your choice of salad, soup or chili. 

I had the boar and it was excellent.  My husband had the strip steak and it was ok.

The ambiance is great. 

Overall we had a wonderful time!

I'm in Indianapolis almost every other month because my lovely sister just had a baby girl. Normally, we just stay in and I cook. But I was absolutely craving some Chinese food this week. I googled some places and Dragon House Chinese Eatery had decent reviews and was a short drive away.

We ordered the Family Dinner for 4 Special which came with spring rolls or soup, fried rice, lo mein, and 2 meat entrees for $23.99 -- great deal there, you can't go wrong! We ordered the spring rolls, veggie fried rice, veggie lo mein, chinese vegetables and sesame chicken. Additionally, we got crab rangoon and singapore noodles. Overall, the food was okay but for our group tasted underseasoned. The singapore noodles were very delicious and had a great curry flavor though. The sesame chicken also had a great flavor. But the rest, eh. Not my favorite. But hit the spot for a quick Chinese food take out craving.

Customer service was fantastic. I was able to call and place my order with ease and my food was ready in 15 minutes. Inside, the restaurant is clean and nicely decorated. Other reviews said the buffet is great so maybe eat in.

Still remains a solid five stars. I once went in here with seven other friends by my urging and the kind staff let them sample many their hearts desire. I love their punch card system - definitely keeps me coming back to them. They're also conveniently located (very close to rooster which is quickly becoming a frequent brunch spot among my friend group).

I do want to try coming here to study one day. They're definitely open later than most cafes. Seems like a great little hideout/ change of scenery from the usual.

I was really hoping I would love The Hattery, but it fell pretty flat.

First thing's first, the space is stunning. They sat us downstairs which I liked less than the upstairs but the whole vibe is eclectic, casual and fun. 

The menu runs the gamut from steak to seafood to pasta to bibimbop. We started with the pork belly and it was good, nothing amazing. We had read other yelpers' positive reviews of the burgers so we ordered the Pierre (Gruyere with carmelized onion) Kobe beef burger and the Chicken and the Egg burger (fried chicken, bacon, fried egg). Both were (sadly) underwhelming. The burger was so greasy it was almost inedible and the chicken burger was overdone and hard to eat. The fries were good, though.

For dessert the waitress touted the apple tartine as their specialty. Only it just wasn't super special, just super tasteless.

All in all, the atmosphere is five stars but the food was underwhelming and forgettable. With all the great restaurants in Doylestown, I doubt we will rush back to The Hattery.

Nestled inside a wine shop, this spot is super intimate (as in extra cozy) with something thirty seats. The ambiance makes for a perfect date night. Peruse the the shop before dinner, but a bottle and take it to the table with you. The wine selection at the shop (also known as The Rum Runner) is impressively varied and well priced. Their Wine shop/ restaurant concept was one of the first to hit Tucson and they certainly do it well. On the food front, they're Known for their Mussels, a definite must try. We enjoyed a bowl of those tonight. With a Caesar salad, fancy salad and the salmon dish. Everything was flavorful and well portioned, but a bit on the salty side. Wine by the glass is nicely priced. I love that their keep it real with their wine prices. So many restaurants in town mark up their wines to the point of of greed and that's a major turn off. Two servers usually handle the floor an handle it well attentively. The Dish is a solid go-to for locals and visitors alike.

I am by no means a pho expert.. or a pho snob. I know what I like, I'm pretty easy to please.. and Lilly's is pretty damn good. I've been fighting this cold for a while now, and I finally decided.. enough was enough.  It was time for some spicy pho. 

Lilly's is down the street from me, and it's a shame I hadn't been until now. I picked up some chicken pho to go, some egg rolls, and the grilled beef bahn mi. The pho is just what I needed (and currently, I'm finishing the 2nd half of it for lunch today.. just as good in round 2).. fresh taste, great broth, and a LOT of it. Great egg rolls too. My boyfriend didn't love his bahn mi, but he can be picky about his sandwiches. But the meat was well seasoned and delicious.
